   21: %% This is a development feature when developing a new file module,
   22: %% ugly but practical.
   23: -ifndef(FILE_MODULE).
   24: -define(FILE_MODULE, file).
   25: -endif.
   26: -ifndef(FILE_SUITE).
   27: -define(FILE_SUITE, file_SUITE).
   28: -endif.
   29: -ifndef(FILE_INIT).
   30: -define(FILE_INIT(Config), Config).
   31: -endif.
   32: -ifndef(FILE_FINI).
   33: -define(FILE_FINI(Config), Config).
   34: -endif.
   35: -ifndef(FILE_INIT_PER_TESTCASE).
   36: -define(FILE_INIT_PER_TESTCASE(Config), Config).
   37: -endif.
   38: -ifndef(FILE_FIN_PER_TESTCASE).
   39: -define(FILE_FIN_PER_TESTCASE(Config), Config).
   40: -endif.
   41: 
   42: -define(PRIM_FILE, prim_file).
   43: 
   44: -module(?FILE_SUITE).

  128: suite() ->
  129:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},

  141:     ].

  143: groups() -> 
  144:     [{dirs, [], [make_del_dir, make_del_dir_r, cur_dir_0, cur_dir_1,
  145: 		 list_dir, list_dir_error, untranslatable_names,
  146: 		 untranslatable_names_error]},
  147:      {files, [],
  148:       [{group, open}, {group, pos}, {group, file_info},
  149:        {group, consult}, {group, eval}, {group, script},
  150:        truncate, sync, datasync, advise, allocate, allocate_file_size]},
  151:      {open, [],
  152:       [open1, old_modes, new_modes, path_open, close, access,
  153:        read_write, pread_write, append, open_errors,
  154:        exclusive]},
  155:      {pos, [], [pos1, pos2, pos3]},

  157:       [file_info_basic_file, file_info_basic_directory,
  158:        file_info_bad, file_info_times,

  165:      {script, [], [script1, path_script]},
  166:      {errors, [],

  168:      {compression, [],

  170:        read_cooked_tar_problem, read_not_really_compressed,
  171:        write_compressed, compress_errors, catenated_gzips,

  179: 
  180: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  181:     Config.
  182: 
  183: end_per_group(bench, Config) ->
  184:     ScratchDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  185:     file:delete(filename:join(ScratchDir, "benchmark_scratch_file")),
  186:     Config;
  187: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  188:     Config.
  189: 
  190: 
  191: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  192:     SaslConfig = case application:start(sasl) of
  193: 		     {error, {already_started, sasl}} ->
  194: 			 [];
  195: 		     ok ->
  196: 			 [{sasl,started}]
  197: 		 end,
  198:     application:start(os_mon),
  199: 
  200:     case os:type() of
  201: 	{win32, _} ->
  202: 	    Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  203: 	    HasAccessTime =
  204: 		case ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Priv) of
  205: 		    {ok, #file_info{atime={_, {0, 0, 0}}}} ->
  206: 			%% This is a unfortunately a FAT file system.
  207: 			[no_access_time];
  208: 		    {ok, _} ->
  209: 			[]
  210: 		end,
  211: 	    ?FILE_INIT(HasAccessTime++Config++SaslConfig);
  212: 	_ ->
  213: 	    ?FILE_INIT(Config++SaslConfig)
  214:     end.
  215: 
  216: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  217:     case os:type() of
  218: 	{win32, _} ->
  219: 	    os:cmd("subst z: /d");
  220: 	_ ->
  221: 	    ok
  222:     end,
  223: 
  224:     application:stop(os_mon),
  225:     case proplists:get_value(sasl, Config) of
  226: 	started ->
  227: 	    application:stop(sasl);
  228: 	_Else ->
  229: 	    ok
  230:     end,
  231:     ?FILE_FINI(Config).
  232: 
  233: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  234:     %%error_logger:info_msg("~p:~p *****~n", [?MODULE, _Func]),
  235:     ?FILE_INIT_PER_TESTCASE(Config).
  236: 
  237: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  238:     %% error_logger:info_msg("~p:~p END *****~n", [?MODULE, _Func]),
  239:     ?FILE_FIN_PER_TESTCASE(Config).
  240: 
  241: %% Matches a term (the last) against alternatives
  242: expect(X, _, X) ->
  243:     X;
  244: expect(_, X, X) ->
  245:     X.
  246: 
  247: expect(X, _, _, X) ->
  248:     X;
  249: expect(_, X, _, X) ->
  250:     X;
  251: expect(_, _, X, X) ->
  252:     X.
  253: 
  254: expect(X, _, _, _, X) ->
  255:     X;
  256: expect(_, X, _, _, X) ->
  257:     X;
  258: expect(_, _, X, _, X) ->
  259:     X;
  260: expect(_, _, _, X, X) ->
  261:     X.
  262: 
  263: %% Calculate the time difference
  264: time_dist({YY, MM, DD, H, M, S}, DT) ->
  265:     time_dist({{YY, MM, DD}, {H, M, S}}, DT);
  266: time_dist(DT, {YY, MM, DD, H, M, S}) ->
  267:     time_dist(DT, {{YY, MM, DD}, {H, M, S}});
  268: time_dist({_D1, _T1} = DT1, {_D2, _T2} = DT2) ->
  269:     calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(DT2)
  270: 	- calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(DT1).
  271: 
  272: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  273: mini_server(Parent) ->
  274:     receive
  275: 	die ->
  276: 	    ok;
  277: 	{io_request,From,To,{put_chars,_Encoding,Data}} ->
  278: 	    Parent ! {io_request,From,To,{put_chars,Data}},
  279: 	    From ! {io_reply, To, ok},
  280: 	    mini_server(Parent);
  281: 	{io_request,From,To,{get_chars,_Encoding,'',N}} ->
  282: 	    Parent ! {io_request,From,To,{get_chars,'',N}},
  283: 	    From ! {io_reply, To, {ok, lists:duplicate(N,$a)}},
  284: 	    mini_server(Parent);
  285: 	{io_request,From,To,{get_line,_Encoding,''}} ->
  286: 	    Parent ! {io_request,From,To,{get_line,''}},
  287: 	    From ! {io_reply, To, {ok, "hej\n"}},
  288: 	    mini_server(Parent)
  289:     end.
  290: 
  291: %% Test that standard i/o-servers work with file module.
  292: standard_io(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  293:     %% Really just a smoke test
  294:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE,mini_server,[self()]),
  295:     register(mini_server,Pid),
  296:     ok = file:write(mini_server,<<"hej\n">>),
  297:     receive
  298: 	{io_request,_,_,{put_chars,<<"hej\n">>}} ->
  299: 	    ok
  300:     after 1000 ->
  301: 	    exit(noreply)
  302:     end,
  303:     {ok,"aaaaa"} = file:read(mini_server,5),
  304:     receive
  305: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_chars,'',5}} ->
  306: 	    ok
  307:     after 1000 ->
  308: 	    exit(noreply)
  309:     end,
  310:     {ok,"hej\n"} = file:read_line(mini_server),
  311:     receive
  312: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_line,''}} ->
  313: 	    ok
  314:     after 1000 ->
  315: 	    exit(noreply)
  316:     end,
  317:     OldGL = group_leader(),
  318:     group_leader(Pid,self()),
  319:     ok = file:write(standard_io,<<"hej\n">>),
  320:     group_leader(OldGL,self()),
  321:     receive
  322: 	{io_request,_,_,{put_chars,<<"hej\n">>}} ->
  323: 	    ok
  324:     after 1000 ->
  325: 	    exit(noreply)
  326:     end,
  327:     group_leader(Pid,self()),
  328:     {ok,"aaaaa"} = file:read(standard_io,5),
  329:     group_leader(OldGL,self()),
  330:     receive
  331: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_chars,'',5}} ->
  332: 	    ok
  333:     after 1000 ->
  334: 	    exit(noreply)
  335:     end,
  336:     group_leader(Pid,self()),
  337:     {ok,"hej\n"} = file:read_line(standard_io),
  338:     group_leader(OldGL,self()),
  339:     receive
  340: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_line,''}} ->
  341: 	    ok
  342:     after 1000 ->
  343: 	    exit(noreply)
  344:     end,
  345:     Pid ! die,
  346:     receive after 1000 -> ok end.
  347: 
  348: %% Test that the old file IO protocol =< R16B still works.
  349: old_io_protocol(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  350:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  351:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  352: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  353: 			 ++"old_io_protocol.fil"),
  354:     MyData = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz",
  355:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, MyData),
  356:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
  357:     Fd ! {file_request,self(),Fd,truncate},
  358:     receive
  359: 	{file_reply,Fd,ok} -> ok
  360:     end,
  361:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
  362:     {ok, <<>>} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  363:     [] = flush(),
  364:     ok.
  365: 
  366: unicode_mode(Config) ->
  367:     Dir = {dir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)},
  368:     OptVariants = [[Dir],
  369: 		   [Dir, {encoding, utf8}],
  370: 		   [Dir, binary],
  371: 		   [Dir, binary, {encoding, utf8}]
  372: 		  ],
  373:     ReadVariants = [{read, fun(Fd) -> um_read(Fd, fun(Fd1) -> file:read(Fd1, 1024) end) end},
  374: 		    {read_line, fun(Fd) -> um_read(Fd, fun(Fd1) -> file:read_line(Fd1) end) end}
  375: 		    %%{pread, fun(Fd) -> file:pread(Fd, 0, 1024) end},
  376: 		    %%{preadl, fun(Fd) -> file:pread(Fd, [{0, 1024}]) end},
  377: 		   ],
  378: 
  379:     _ = [read_write_0("ASCII: list:  Hello World", Read, Opt) ||
  380: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  381:     _ = [read_write_0("LATIN1: list: åäöÅÄÖ", Read, Opt) ||
  382: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  383:     _ = [read_write_0(<<"ASCII: bin: Hello World">>, Read, Opt) ||
  384: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  385:     _ = [read_write_0(<<"LATIN1: bin: åäöÅÄÖ">>, Read, Opt) ||
  386: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  387:     %% These will be double encoded if option is encoding utf-8
  388:     _ = [read_write_0(<<"UTF8: bin: Ωß"/utf8>>, Read, Opt) ||
  389: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  390:     %% These should not work (with encoding set to utf-8)
  391:     %%   according to file's documentation
  392:     _ = [read_write_0("UTF8: list: Ωß", Read, Opt) ||
  393: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  394:     ok.
  395: 
  396: read_write_0(Str, {Func, ReadFun}, Options) ->
  397:     try
  398: 	Res = read_write_1(Str, ReadFun, Options),
  399: 	io:format("~p: ~ts ~p '~p'~n", [Func, Str, tl(Options), Res]),
  400: 	ok
  401:     catch {fail, Line, ReadBytes = [_|_]} ->
  402: 	    io:format("~p:~p: ~p ERROR: ~w vs~n             ~w~n  - ~p~n",
  403: 		      [?MODULE, Line, Func, Str, ReadBytes, Options]),
  404: 	    exit({error, ?LINE});
  405: 	  {fail, Line, ReadBytes} ->
  406: 	    io:format("~p:~p: ~p ERROR: ~ts vs~n             ~w~n  - ~p~n",
  407: 		      [?MODULE, Line, Func, Str, ReadBytes, Options]),
  408: 	    exit({error, ?LINE});
  409: 	  error:What:Stacktrace ->
  410: 	    io:format("~p:??: ~p ERROR: ~p from~n  ~w~n  ~p~n",
  411: 		      [?MODULE, Func, What, Str, Options]),
  412: 
  413: 	    io:format("\t~p~n", [Stacktrace]),
  414: 	    exit({error, ?LINE})
  415:     end.
  416: 
  417: read_write_1(Str0, ReadFun, [{dir,Dir}|Options]) ->
  418:     File = um_filename(Str0, Dir, Options),
  419:     Pre = "line 1\n", Post = "\nlast line\n",
  420:     Str = case is_list(Str0) andalso lists:max(Str0) > 255 of
  421: 	      false ->  %% Normal case Use options
  422: 		  {ok, FdW} = file:open(File, [write|Options]),
  423: 		  IO = [Pre, Str0, Post],
  424: 		  ok = file:write(FdW, IO),
  425: 		  case is_binary(Str0) of
  426: 		      true -> iolist_to_binary(IO);
  427: 		      false -> lists:append(IO)
  428: 		  end;
  429: 	      true -> %% Test unicode lists
  430: 		  {ok, FdW} = file:open(File, [write]),
  431: 		  Utf8 = unicode:characters_to_binary([Pre, Str0, Post]),
  432: 		  file:write(FdW, Utf8),
  433: 		  {unicode, Utf8}
  434: 	  end,
  435:     file:close(FdW),
  436:     {ok, FdR} = file:open(File, [read|Options]),
  437:     ReadRes = ReadFun(FdR),
  438:     file:close(FdR),
  439:     Res = um_check(Str, ReadRes, Options),
  440:     file:delete(File),
  441:     Res.
  442: 
  443: 
  444: um_read(Fd, Fun) ->
  445:     um_read(Fd, Fun, []).
  446: 
  447: um_read(Fd, Fun, Acc) ->
  448:     case Fun(Fd) of
  449: 	eof ->
  450: 	    case is_binary(hd(Acc)) of
  451: 		true  -> {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))};
  452: 		false -> {ok, lists:append(lists:reverse(Acc))}
  453: 	    end;
  454: 	{ok, Data} ->
  455: 	    um_read(Fd, Fun, [Data|Acc]);
  456: 	Error ->
  457: 	    Error
  458:     end.
  459: 
  460: 
  461: um_check(Str, {ok, Str}, _) -> ok;
  462: um_check(Bin, {ok, Res}, _Options) when is_binary(Bin), is_list(Res) ->
  463:     case list_to_binary(Res) of
  464: 	Bin -> ok;
  465: 	_ -> ?THROW_ERROR(Res)
  466:     end;
  467: um_check(Str, {ok, Res}, _Options) when is_list(Str), is_binary(Res) ->
  468:     case iolist_to_binary(Str) of
  469: 	Res -> ok;
  470: 	_ -> ?THROW_ERROR(Res)
  471:     end;
  472: um_check({unicode, Utf8Bin}, Res, Options) ->
  473:     um_check_unicode(Utf8Bin, Res,
  474: 		     proplists:get_value(binary, Options, false),
  475: 		     proplists:get_value(encoding, Options, none));
  476: um_check(_Str, Res, _Options) ->
  477:     ?THROW_ERROR(Res).
  478: 
  479: um_check_unicode(Utf8Bin, {ok, Utf8Bin}, true, none) ->
  480:     ok;
  481: um_check_unicode(Utf8Bin, {ok, List = [_|_]}, false, none) ->
  482:     case binary_to_list(Utf8Bin) == List of
  483: 	true -> ok;
  484: 	false -> ?THROW_ERROR(List)
  485:     end;
  486: um_check_unicode(_Utf8Bin, {error, {no_translation, unicode, latin1}}, _, _) ->
  487:     no_translation;
  488: um_check_unicode(_Utf8Bin, Error = {error, _}, _, _Unicode) ->
  489:     ?THROW_ERROR(Error);
  490: um_check_unicode(_Utf8Bin, {ok, _ListOrBin}, _, _UTF8_) ->
  491:     %% List = if is_binary(ListOrBin) -> unicode:characters_to_list(ListOrBin);
  492:     %% 	      true -> ListOrBin
  493:     %% 	   end,
  494:     %% io:format("In: ~w~n", [binary_to_list(Utf8Bin)]),
  495:     %% io:format("Ut: ~w~n", [List]),
  496:     ?THROW_ERROR({shoud_be, no_translation}).
  497: 
  498: um_filename(Bin, Dir, Options) when is_binary(Bin) ->
  499:     um_filename(binary_to_list(Bin), Dir, Options);
  500: um_filename(Str = [_|_], Dir, Options) ->
  501:     Name = hd(string:lexemes(Str, ":")),
  502:     Enc = atom_to_list(proplists:get_value(encoding, Options, latin1)),
  503:     File = case lists:member(binary, Options) of
  504: 	       true ->
  505: 		   "test_" ++ Name ++ "_bin_enc_" ++ Enc;
  506: 	       false ->
  507: 		   "test_" ++ Name ++ "_list_enc_" ++ Enc
  508: 	   end,
  509:     filename:join(Dir, File).
  510: 
  511: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  512: 
  513: read_write_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  514:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  515:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  516: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  517: 			 ++"_read_write_file"),
  518: 
  519:     %% Try writing and reading back some term
  520:     SomeTerm = {"This term",{will,be},[written,$t,$o],1,file,[]},
  521:     Bin1 = term_to_binary(SomeTerm),
  522:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, Bin1),
  523: 
  524:     %% Try a "null" term
  525:     NullTerm = [],
  526:     Bin2 = term_to_binary(NullTerm),
  527:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, Bin2),
  528: 
  529:     %% Try reading a nonexistent file
  530:     Name2 = filename:join(RootDir,
  531: 			  atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  532: 			  ++"_nonexistent_file"),
  533:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name2),
  534:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(""),
  535:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(''),
  536:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name2, [raw]),
  537:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file("", [raw]),
  538:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file('', [raw]),
  539: 
  540:     %% Try writing to a bad filename
  541:     {error, enoent} = do_read_write_file("", Bin2),
  542: 
  543:     %% Try writing something else than a binary
  544:     {error, badarg} = do_read_write_file(Name, {1,2,3}),
  545:     {error, badarg} = do_read_write_file(Name, self()),
  546: 
  547:     %% Some non-term binaries
  548:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, []),
  549: 
  550:     %% Write some iolists
  551:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, [Bin1,[],[[Bin2]]]),
  552:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, ["string",<<"binary">>]),
  553:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, "pure string"),
  554: 
  555:     [] = flush(),
  556:     ok.
  557: 
  558: do_read_write_file(Name, Data) ->
  559:     case ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data) of
  560: 	ok ->
  561: 	    BinData = iolist_to_binary(Data),
  562: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  563: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name, [raw]),
  564: 
  565: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, []),
  566: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  567: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name, [raw]),
  568: 
  569: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, [raw]),
  570: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  571: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name, [raw]),
  572: 
  573: 	    ok;
  574: 	{error,_}=Res ->
  575: 	    Res = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, []),
  576: 	    Res = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, [raw]),
  577: 	    Res
  578:     end.
  579: 
  580: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  581: 
  582: 
  583: make_del_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  584:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  585:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  586: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  587: 			   ++"_mk-dir"),
  588:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  589:     {error, eexist} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  590:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir),
  591:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir),
  592:     %% Make sure we are not in a directory directly under test_server
  593:     %% as that would result in eacces errors when trying to delete '..',
  594:     %% because there are processes having that directory as current.
  595:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  596:     {ok,CurrentDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  597:     case {os:type(), length(NewDir) >= 260 } of
  598: 	{{win32,_}, true} ->
  599: 	    io:format("Skip set_cwd for windows path longer than 260 (MAX_PATH)\n", []),
  600: 	    io:format("\nNewDir = ~p\n", [NewDir]);
  601:     	_ ->
  602: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(NewDir)
  603:     end,
  604:     try
  605: 	%% Check that we get an error when trying to create...
  606: 	%% a deep directory
  607: 	NewDir2 = filename:join(RootDir,
  608: 				atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  609: 				++"_mk-dir-noexist/foo"),
  610: 	{error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir2),
  611: 	%% a nameless directory
  612: 	{error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(""),
  613: 	%% a directory with illegal name
  614: 	{error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir({1,2,3}),
  615: 
  616: 	%% a directory with illegal name, even if it's a (bad) list
  617: 	{error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir([1,2,3,{}]),
  618: 
  619: 	%% Maybe this isn't an error, exactly, but worth mentioning anyway:
  620: 	%% ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir([$f,$o,$o,0,$b,$a,$r])),
  621: 	%% The above line works, and created a directory "./foo"
  622: 	%% More elegant would maybe have been to fail, or to really create
  623: 	%% a directory, but with a name that incorporates the "bar" part of
  624: 	%% the list, so that [$f,$o,$o,0,$f,$o,$o] wouldn't refer to the same
  625: 	%% dir. But this would slow it down.
  626: 
  627: 	%% Try deleting some bad directories
  628: 	%% Deleting the parent directory to the current, sounds dangerous, huh?
  629: 	%% Don't worry ;-) the parent directory should never be empty, right?
  630: 	case ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir('..') of
  631: 	    {error, eexist} -> ok;
  632: 	    {error, eacces} -> ok;		%OpenBSD
  633: 	    {error, einval} -> ok			%FreeBSD
  634: 	end,
  635: 	{error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(""),
  636: 	{error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir([3,2,1,{}]),
  637: 
  638: 	[] = flush()
  639:     after
  640: 	?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(CurrentDir)
  641:     end,
  642:     ok.
  643: 
  644: make_del_dir_r(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  645:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  646:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir, ?MODULE_STRING ++ "_make_del_dir_r"),
  647:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  648: 
  649:     %% Create:
  650:     %% newdir/
  651:     %%     file1
  652:     %%     dir/
  653:     %%         file2
  654:     %%         link -> /newdir/file1
  655:     File1 = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(NewDir, "file1")),
  656:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(File1, <<"file1">>),
  657:     Dir = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(NewDir, "dir")),
  658:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(Dir),
  659:     File2 = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(Dir, "file2")),
  660:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(File2, <<"file2">>),
  661:     Link = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(Dir, "link")),
  662:     case ?FILE_MODULE:make_symlink(File1, Link) of
  663:         {error, enotsup} -> ok; % symlinks not supported
  664:         {error, eperm} -> {win32, _} = os:type(), ok; % not allowed to make symlinks
  665:         ok -> ok
  666:     end,
  667: 
  668:     %% check that del_dir_r/1 succeeds on non-empty dir
  669:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir_r(Dir),
  670:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Dir),
  671:     %% check that the symlink wasn't followed
  672:     {ok, _} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(File1),
  673: 
  674:     %% clean up
  675:     ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir_r(NewDir),
  676:     [] = flush(),
  677:     ok.
  678: 
  679: cur_dir_0(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  680:     %% Find out the current dir, and cd to it ;-)
  681:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(),
  682:     Dir1 = BaseDir ++ "", %% Check that it's a string
  683:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  684: 
  685:     %% Make a new dir, and cd to that
  686:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  687:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  688: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  689: 			   ++"_curdir"),
  690:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  691:     case {os:type(), length(NewDir) >= 260} of
  692: 	{{win32,_}, true} ->
  693: 	    io:format("Skip set_cwd for windows path longer than 260 (MAX_PATH):\n"),
  694: 	    io:format("\nNewDir = ~p\n", [NewDir]);
  695: 	_ ->
  696: 	    io:format("cd to ~s",[NewDir]),
  697:     	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(NewDir),
  698: 
  699: 	    %% Create a file in the new current directory, and check that it
  700: 	    %% really is created there
  701: 	    UncommonName = "uncommon.fil",
  702: 	    {ok,Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(UncommonName,read_write),
  703: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
  704: 	    {ok,NewDirFiles} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("."),
  705: 	    true = lists:member(UncommonName,NewDirFiles),
  706: 
  707: 	    %% Ensure that we get the same result with a trailing slash; the
  708: 	    %% APIs used on Windows will choke on them if passed directly.
  709: 	    {ok,NewDirFiles} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("./"),
  710: 
  711: 	    %% Delete the directory and return to the old current directory
  712: 	    %% and check that the created file isn't there (too!)
  713: 	    expect({error, einval}, {error, eacces}, 
  714: 	    	   ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir)),
  715: 	    ?FILE_MODULE:delete(UncommonName),
  716: 	    {ok,[]} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("."),
  717: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  718: 	    io:format("cd back to ~s",[Dir1]),
  719: 
  720: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir),
  721: 	    {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(NewDir),
  722: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  723: 	    io:format("cd back to ~s",[Dir1]),
  724: 	    {ok,OldDirFiles} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("."),
  725: 	    false = lists:member(UncommonName,OldDirFiles)
  726:     end,
  727: 
  728:     %% Try doing some bad things
  729:     {error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd({foo,bar}),
  730:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(""),
  731:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(".......a......"),
  732:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(), %% Still there?
  733: 
  734:     %% On Windows, there should only be slashes, no backslashes,
  735:     %% in the return value of get_cwd().
  736:     %% (The test is harmless on Unix, because filenames usually
  737:     %% don't contain backslashes.)
  738: 
  739:     {ok, BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(),
  740:     false = lists:member($\\, BaseDir),
  741: 
  742:     [] = flush(),
  743:     ok.
  744: 
  745: %% Tests ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd/1.
  746: 
  747: cur_dir_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  748:     case os:type() of
  749: 	{win32, _} ->
  750: 	    win_cur_dir_1(Config);
  751: 	_ ->
  752: 	    {error, enotsup} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd("d:")
  753:     end,
  754:     [] = flush(),
  755:     ok.
  756: 
  757: win_cur_dir_1(_Config) ->
  758:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(),
  759: 
  760:     %% Get the drive letter from the current directory,
  761:     %% and try to get current directory for that drive.
  762: 
  763:     [CurDrive,$:|_] = BaseDir,
  764:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd([CurDrive,$:]),
  765:     io:format("BaseDir = ~s\n", [BaseDir]),
  766: 
  767:     %% We should error out on non-existent drives. Any reasonable system will
  768:     %% have at least one.
  769:     CurDirs = [?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd([Drive,$:]) || Drive <- lists:seq($A, $Z)],
  770:     lists:member({error,eaccess}, CurDirs),
  771: 
  772:     %% Unfortunately, there is no way to move away from the
  773:     %% current drive as we can't use the "subst" command from
  774:     %% a SSH connection. We can't test any more.
  775: 
  776:     ok.
  777: 
  778: 
  779: %%%
  780: %%% Test list_dir() on a non-existing pathname.
  781: %%%
  782: 
  783: list_dir_error(Config) ->
  784:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  785:     NonExisting = filename:join(Priv, "non-existing-dir"),
  786:     {error,enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir(NonExisting),
  787:     ok.
  788: 
  789: %%%
  790: %%% Test list_dir() and list_dir_all().
  791: %%%
  792: 
  793: list_dir(Config) ->
  794:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  795:     TestDir = filename:join(RootDir, ?MODULE_STRING++"_list_dir"),
  796:     ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(TestDir),
  797:     list_dir_1(TestDir, 42, []).
  798: 
  799: list_dir_1(TestDir, 0, Sorted) ->
  800:     [ok = ?FILE_MODULE:delete(filename:join(TestDir, F)) ||
  801: 	F <- Sorted],
  802:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(TestDir);
  803: list_dir_1(TestDir, Cnt, Sorted0) ->
  804:     Base = "file" ++ integer_to_list(Cnt),
  805:     Name = filename:join(TestDir, Base),
  806:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Base),
  807:     Sorted = lists:merge([Base], Sorted0),
  808:     {ok,DirList0} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir(TestDir),
  809:     {ok,DirList1} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir_all(TestDir),
  810:     Sorted = lists:sort(DirList0),
  811:     Sorted = lists:sort(DirList1),
  812:     list_dir_1(TestDir, Cnt-1, Sorted).
  813: 
  814: untranslatable_names(Config) ->
  815:     case no_untranslatable_names() of
  816: 	false ->
  817: 	    untranslatable_names_1(Config);
  818:         os ->
  819: 	    {skip,"Not a problem on this OS"};
  820:         fs ->
  821:             {skip,"Not a problem on this FS"}
  822:     end.
  823: 
  824: untranslatable_names_1(Config) ->
  825:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  826:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  827:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "untranslatable_names"),
  828:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  829:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnu"]),
  830:     try
  831: 	ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  832: 	[ok = file:write_file(F, F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  833: 
  834: 	ExpectedListDir0 = [unicode:characters_to_list(N, utf8) ||
  835: 			       {utf8,N} <- untranslatable_names()],
  836: 	ExpectedListDir = lists:sort(ExpectedListDir0),
  837: 	io:format("ExpectedListDir: ~p\n", [ExpectedListDir]),
  838: 	ExpectedListDir = call_and_sort(Node, file, list_dir, [Dir]),
  839: 
  840: 	ExpectedListDirAll0 = [case Enc of
  841: 				   utf8 ->
  842: 				       unicode:characters_to_list(N, utf8);
  843: 				   latin1 ->
  844: 				       N
  845: 			       end || {Enc,N} <- untranslatable_names()],
  846: 	ExpectedListDirAll = lists:sort(ExpectedListDirAll0),
  847: 	io:format("ExpectedListDirAll: ~p\n", [ExpectedListDirAll]),
  848: 	ExpectedListDirAll = call_and_sort(Node, file, list_dir_all, [Dir])
  849:     after
  850: 	catch peer:stop(Peer),
  851: 	file:set_cwd(OldCwd),
  852: 	[file:delete(F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  853: 	file:del_dir(Dir)
  854:     end,
  855:     ok.
  856: 
  857: untranslatable_names_error(Config) ->
  858:     case no_untranslatable_names() of
  859: 	false ->
  860: 	    untranslatable_names_error_1(Config);
  861:         os ->
  862: 	    {skip,"Not a problem on this OS"};
  863:         fs ->
  864:             {skip,"Not a problem on this FS"}
  865:     end.
  866: 
  867: untranslatable_names_error_1(Config) ->
  868:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  869:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  870:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "untranslatable_names_error"),
  871:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  872:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnue"]),
  873:     try
  874: 	ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  875: 	[ok = file:write_file(F, F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  876: 
  877: 	ExpectedListDir0 = [unicode:characters_to_list(N, utf8) ||
  878: 			       {utf8,N} <- untranslatable_names()],
  879: 	ExpectedListDir = lists:sort(ExpectedListDir0),
  880: 	io:format("ExpectedListDir: ~p\n", [ExpectedListDir]),
  881: 	{error,{no_translation,BadFile}} =
  882: 	    rpc:call(Node, file, list_dir, [Dir]),
  883: 	true = lists:keymember(BadFile, 2, untranslatable_names())
  884: 
  885:     after
  886: 	catch peer:stop(Peer),
  887: 	file:set_cwd(OldCwd),
  888: 	[file:delete(F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  889: 	file:del_dir(Dir)
  890:     end,
  891:     ok.
  892: 
  893: untranslatable_names() ->
  894:     [{utf8,<<"abc">>},
  895:      {utf8,<<"def">>},
  896:      {utf8,<<"Lagerl",195,182,"f">>},
  897:      {utf8,<<195,150,"stra Emterwik">>},
  898:      {latin1,<<"M",229,"rbacka">>},
  899:      {latin1,<<"V",228,"rmland">>}].
  900: 
  901: call_and_sort(Node, M, F, A) ->
  902:     {ok,Res} = rpc:call(Node, M, F, A),
  903:     lists:sort(Res).
  904: 
  905: no_untranslatable_names() ->
  906:     case os:type() of
  907: 	{unix,darwin} -> os;
  908: 	{win32,_} -> os;
  909: 	_ ->
  910:             %% If we are using utf8only on zfs then we cannot create latin1 characters.
  911:             case os:find_executable("zfs") of
  912:                 false ->
  913:                     false;
  914:                 _Zfs ->
  915:                     case os:cmd("zfs get utf8only `pwd` | grep utf8only | awk '{print $3}'") of
  916:                         "on" ++ _ ->
  917:                             fs;
  918:                         _ ->
  919:                             false
  920:                     end
  921:             end
  922:     end.
  923: 
  924: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  925: 
  926: 
  927: 
  928: open1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  929:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  930:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  931: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  932: 			   ++"_files"),
  933:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  934:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  935:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read_write),
  936:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
  937:     Str = "{a,tuple}.\n",
  938:     io:format(Fd1,Str,[]),
  939:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd1,bof),
  940:     Str = io:get_line(Fd1,''),
  941:     Str = io:get_line(Fd2,''),
  942:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
  943:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd1,bof),
  944:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd1),
  945:     eof = io:get_line(Fd1,''),
  946:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
  947:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
  948:     eof = io:get_line(Fd3,''),
  949:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
  950:     [] = flush(),
  951:     ok.
  952: 
  953: %% Tests all open modes.
  954: 
  955: old_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  956:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  957:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  958: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  959: 			   ++"_old_open_modes"),
  960:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  961:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  962:     Marker = "hello, world",
  963: 
  964:     %% write
  965:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, write),
  966:     ok = io:write(Fd1, Marker),
  967:     ok = io:put_chars(Fd1, ".\n"),
  968:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
  969: 
  970:     %% read
  971:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, read),
  972:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd2, prompt),
  973:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
  974: 
  975:     %% read_write
  976:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, read_write),
  977:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd3, prompt),
  978:     ok = io:write(Fd3, Marker),
  979:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
  980: 
  981:     [] = flush(),
  982:     ok.
  983: 
  984: 
  985: new_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  986:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  987:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  988: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  989: 			   ++"_new_open_modes"),
  990:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  991:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  992:     Marker = "hello, world",
  993: 
  994:     %% write
  995:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [write]),
  996:     ok = io:write(Fd1, Marker),
  997:     ok = io:put_chars(Fd1, ".\n"),
  998:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
  999: 
 1000:     %% read
 1001:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read]),
 1002:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd2, prompt),
 1003:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1004: 
 1005:     %% read and write
 1006:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, write]),
 1007:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd3, prompt),
 1008:     ok = io:write(Fd3, Marker),
 1009:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1010: 
 1011:     %% read by default
 1012:     {ok, Fd4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, []),
 1013:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd4, prompt),
 1014:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd4),
 1015: 
 1016:     %% read and binary
 1017:     {ok, Fd5} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, binary]),
 1018:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd5, prompt),
 1019:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd5),
 1020: 
 1021:     %% read, raw
 1022:     {ok, Fd6} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, raw]),
 1023:     {ok, [$\[]} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(Fd6, 1),
 1024:      ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd6),
 1025: 
 1026:      %% write and sync
 1027:      case ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [write, sync]) of
 1028: 	 {ok, Fd7} ->
 1029: 	     ok = io:write(Fd7, Marker),
 1030: 	     ok = io:put_chars(Fd7, ".\n"),
 1031: 	     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd7),
 1032: 	     {ok, Fd8} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read]),
 1033: 	     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd8, prompt),
 1034: 	     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd8);
 1035: 	 {error, enotsup} ->
 1036: 	     %% for platforms that don't support the sync option
 1037: 	     ok
 1038:      end,
 1039: 
 1040:      % open directory
 1041:      {ok, Fd9} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(NewDir, [directory]),
 1042:      ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd9),
 1043: 
 1044:      % open raw directory
 1045:      {ok, Fd10} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(NewDir, [raw, directory]),
 1046:      ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd10),
 1047: 
 1048:      [] = flush(),
 1049:      ok.
 1050: 
 1051: path_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1052:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1053:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1054: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1055: 			   ++"_path_open"),
 1056:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1057:     FileName = "path_open.fil",
 1058:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 1059:     {ok,Fd1,_FullName1} =
 1060: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1061: 	   [RootDir,
 1062: 	    "nosuch1",
 1063: 	    NewDir],FileName,write),
 1064:     io:format(Fd1,"ABCDEFGH",[]),
 1065:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1066: 
 1067:     %% locate it in the last dir
 1068:     {ok,Fd2,_FullName2} =
 1069: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1070: 	   ["nosuch1",
 1071: 	    NewDir,
 1072: 	    RootDir],FileName,read),
 1073:     {ok,2} =
 1074: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,2), "C" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1075:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1076:     %% Try a failing path
 1077:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1078: 			 ["nosuch1",
 1079: 			  NewDir],FileName,read),
 1080:     %% Check that it's found regardless of path, if an absolute name given
 1081:     {ok,Fd3,_FullPath3} =
 1082: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1083: 	   ["nosuch1",
 1084: 	    NewDir],Name,read),
 1085:     {ok,2} =
 1086: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd3,2), "C" = io:get_chars(Fd3,'',1),
 1087:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1088: 
 1089:     [] = flush(),
 1090:     ok.
 1091: 
 1092: close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1093:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1094:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1095: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1096: 			 ++"_close.fil"),
 1097:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read_write),
 1098:     %% Just closing it is no fun, we did that a million times already
 1099:     %% This is a common error, for code written before Erlang 4.3
 1100:     %% because then ?FILE_MODULE:open just returned a Pid, and not everyone
 1101:     %% really checked what they got.
 1102:     {'EXIT',_Msg} = (catch ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close({ok,Fd1})),
 1103:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1104: 
 1105:     %% Try closing one more time
 1106:     Val = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1107:     io:format("Second close gave: ~p",[Val]),
 1108: 
 1109:     %% All operations on a closed raw file should EINVAL, even if they're not
 1110:     %% supported on the current platform.
 1111:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, write, raw]),
 1112:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1113: 
 1114:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:advise(Fd2, 5, 5, normal),
 1115:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:allocate(Fd2, 5, 5),
 1116:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1117:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:datasync(Fd2),
 1118:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, 5),
 1119:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(Fd2, 5, 1),
 1120:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(Fd2, 5, "einval please"),
 1121:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(Fd2, 1),
 1122:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:sync(Fd2),
 1123:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd2),
 1124:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:write(Fd2, "einval please"),
 1125: 
 1126:     [] = flush(),
 1127:     ok.
 1128: 
 1129: access(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1130:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1131:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1132: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1133: 			 ++"_access.fil"),
 1134:     Str = "ABCDEFGH",
 1135:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1136:     io:format(Fd1,Str,[]),
 1137:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1138:     %% Check that we can't write when in read only mode
 1139:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1140:     case catch io:format(Fd2,"XXXX",[]) of
 1141: 	ok ->
 1142: 	    ct:fail({format,write});
 1143: 	_ ->
 1144: 	    ok
 1145:     end,
 1146:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1147:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1148:     Str = io:get_line(Fd3,''),
 1149:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1150: 
 1151:     [] = flush(),
 1152:     ok.
 1153: 
 1154: %% Tests ?FILE_MODULE:read/2 and ?FILE_MODULE:write/2.
 1155: 
 1156: read_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1157:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1158:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1159: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1160: 			   ++"_read_write"),
 1161:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1162:     Marker = "hello, world",
 1163:     MarkerB = list_to_binary(Marker),
 1164: 
 1165:     %% Plain file.
 1166:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain.fil"),
 1167:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, write]),
 1168:     read_write_test(Fd1, Marker, []),
 1169: 
 1170:     %% Raw file.
 1171:     Name2 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw.fil"),
 1172:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name2, [read, write, raw]),
 1173:     read_write_test(Fd2, Marker, []),
 1174: 
 1175:     %% Plain binary file.
 1176:     Name3 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain-b.fil"),
 1177:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name3, [read, write, binary]),
 1178:     read_write_test(Fd3, MarkerB, <<>>),
 1179: 
 1180:     %% Raw binary file.
 1181:     Name4 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw-b.fil"),
 1182:     {ok, Fd4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name4, [read, write, raw, binary]),
 1183:     read_write_test(Fd4, MarkerB, <<>>),
 1184: 
 1185:     ok.
 1186: 
 1187: read_write_test(File, Marker, Empty) ->
 1188:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write(File, Marker),
 1189:     {ok, 0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(File, 0),
 1190:     {ok, Empty} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 0),
 1191:     {ok, Marker} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 100),
 1192:     eof = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 100),
 1193:     {ok, Empty} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 0),
 1194:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(File),
 1195:     [] = flush(),
 1196:     ok.
 1197: 
 1198: 
 1199: %% Tests ?FILE_MODULE:pread/2 and ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite/2.
 1200: 
 1201: pread_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1202:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1203:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1204: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1205: 			   ++"_pread_write"),
 1206:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1207:     List = "hello, world",
 1208:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
 1209: 
 1210:     %% Plain file.
 1211:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain.fil"),
 1212:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, write]),
 1213:     pread_write_test(Fd1, List),
 1214: 
 1215:     %% Raw file.
 1216:     Name2 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw.fil"),
 1217:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name2, [read, write, raw]),
 1218:     pread_write_test(Fd2, List),
 1219: 
 1220:     %% Plain file. Binary mode.
 1221:     Name3 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain-binary.fil"),
 1222:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name3, [binary, read, write]),
 1223:     pread_write_test(Fd3, Bin),
 1224: 
 1225:     %% Raw file. Binary mode.
 1226:     Name4 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw-binary.fil"),
 1227:     {ok, Fd4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name4, [binary, read, write, raw]),
 1228:     pread_write_test(Fd4, Bin),
 1229: 
 1230:     ok.
 1231: 
 1232: pread_write_test(File, Data) ->
 1233:     io:format("~p:pread_write_test(~p,~p)~n", [?MODULE, File, Data]),
 1234:     Size = if is_binary(Data) -> byte_size(Data);
 1235: 	      is_list(Data) -> length(Data)
 1236: 	   end,
 1237:     I = Size + 17,
 1238:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(File, 0, Data),
 1239:     {ok, Data} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, 0, I),
 1240:     {ok, [Data]} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, [{0, I}]),
 1241:     eof = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, I, 1),
 1242:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(File, [{0, Data}, {I, Data}]),
 1243:     {ok, [Data, eof, Data]} =
 1244: 	?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, [{0, Size}, {2*I, 1}, {I, Size}]),
 1245:     Plist = lists:seq(21*I, 0, -I),
 1246:     Pwrite = lists:map(fun(P)->{P,Data}end, Plist),
 1247:     Pread = [{22*I,Size} | lists:map(fun(P)->{P,Size}end, Plist)],
 1248:     Presult = [eof | lists:map(fun(_)->Data end, Plist)],
 1249:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(File, Pwrite),
 1250:     {ok, Presult} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, Pread),
 1251:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(File),
 1252:     [] = flush(),
 1253:     ok.
 1254: 
 1255: %% Test appending to a file.
 1256: append(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1257:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1258:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1259: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1260: 			   ++"_append"),
 1261:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1262: 
 1263:     First = "First line\n",
 1264:     Second = "Second lines comes here\n",
 1265:     Third = "And here is the third line\n",
 1266: 
 1267:     %% Write a small text file.
 1268:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "a_file.txt"),
 1269:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [write]),
 1270:     ok = io:format(Fd1, First, []),
 1271:     ok = io:format(Fd1, Second, []),
 1272:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1273: 
 1274:     %% Open it a again and a append a line to it.
 1275:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [append]),
 1276:     ok = io:format(Fd2, Third, []),
 1277:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1278: 
 1279:     %% Read it back and verify.
 1280:     Expected = list_to_binary([First, Second, Third]),
 1281:     {ok, Expected} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name1),
 1282: 
 1283:     [] = flush(),
 1284:     ok.
 1285: 
 1286: open_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1287:     DataDir =
 1288: 	filename:dirname(
 1289: 	  filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "x")),
 1290:     DataDirSlash = DataDir++"/",
 1291:     {error, E1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDir, [read]),
 1292:     {error, E2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDirSlash, [read]),
 1293:     {error, E3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDir, [write]),
 1294:     {error, E4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDirSlash, [write]),
 1295:     {eisdir,eisdir,eisdir,eisdir} = {E1,E2,E3,E4},
 1296: 
 1297:     Real = filename:join(DataDir, "realmen.html"),
 1298:     {error, enotdir} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Real, [directory]),
 1299: 
 1300:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ?FILE_MODULE:open("foo", [raw, ram])),
 1301:     [] = flush(),
 1302:     ok.
 1303: 
 1304: %% Test exclusive access to a file.
 1305: exclusive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1306:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1307:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1308: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1309: 			   ++"_exclusive"),
 1310:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1311:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "ex_file.txt"),
 1312:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [write, exclusive]),
 1313:     {error, eexist} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [write, exclusive]),
 1314:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 1315:     ok.
 1316: 
 1317: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1318: 
 1319: 
 1320: pos1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1321:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1322:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1323: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1324: 			 ++"_pos1.fil"),
 1325:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1326:     io:format(Fd1,"ABCDEFGH",[]),
 1327:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1328:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1329: 
 1330:     %% Start pos is first char
 1331:     io:format("Relative positions"),
 1332:     "A" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1333:     {ok,2} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,1}),
 1334:     "C" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1335:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,-3}),
 1336:     "A" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1337:     %% Backwards from first char should be an error
 1338:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,-1}),
 1339:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,-1}),
 1340:     %% Reset position and move again
 1341:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,0),
 1342:     {ok,2} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,2}),
 1343:     "C" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1344:     %% Go a lot forwards
 1345:     {ok,13} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,10}),
 1346:     eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1347: 
 1348:     %% Try some fixed positions
 1349:     io:format("Fixed positions"),
 1350:     {ok,8} =
 1351: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,8), eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1352:     {ok,8} =
 1353: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,cur), eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1354:     {ok,7} =
 1355: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,7), "H" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1356:     {ok,0} =
 1357: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,0), "A" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1358:     {ok,3} =
 1359: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,3), "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1360:     {ok,12} =
 1361: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,12), eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1362:     {ok,3} =
 1363: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,3), "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1364:     %% Try the {bof,X} notation
 1365:     {ok,3} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{bof,3}),
 1366:     "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1367: 
 1368:     %% Try eof positions
 1369:     io:format("EOF positions"),
 1370:     {ok,8} =
 1371: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,0}), eof=io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1372:     {ok,7} =
 1373: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,-1}),
 1374:     "H" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1375:     {ok,0} =
 1376: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,-8}), "A"=io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1377:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,-9}),
 1378: 
 1379:     [] = flush(),
 1380:     ok.
 1381: 
 1382: pos2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1383:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1384:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1385: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1386: 			 ++"_pos2.fil"),
 1387:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1388:     io:format(Fd1,"ABCDEFGH",[]),
 1389:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1390:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1391:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,-1),
 1392: 
 1393:     %% Make sure that we still can search after an error.
 1394:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, 0),
 1395:     {ok,3} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, {bof,3}),
 1396:     "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1397: 
 1398:     [] = flush(),
 1399:     io:format("DONE"),
 1400:     ok.
 1401: 
 1402: %% When it does not use raw mode, file:position had a bug.
 1403: pos3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1404:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1405:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, "realmen.html.gz"),
 1406: 
 1407:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, binary]),
 1408:     {ok, _}  = ?FILE_MODULE:read(Fd, 5),
 1409:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd, {bof, -1}),
 1410: 
 1411:     %% Here ok had returned =(
 1412:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd, {cur, -10}),
 1413:     %% That test is actually questionable since file:position/2
 1414:     %% is documented to leave the file position undefined after
 1415:     %% it has returned an error.  But on Posix systems the position
 1416:     %% is guaranteed to be unchanged after an error return.  On e.g
 1417:     %% Windows there is nothing stated about this in the documentation.
 1418: 
 1419:     ok.
 1420: 
 1421: file_info_basic_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1422:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1423: 
 1424:     %% Create a short file.
 1425:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1426: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1427:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1428:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
 1429:     io:put_chars(Fd1, "foo bar"),
 1430:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1431: 
 1432:     %% Don't crash the file server when passing incorrect arguments.
 1433:     {error,badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [{time, gurka}]),
 1434:     {error,badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info([#{} | gaffel]),
 1435: 
 1436:     %% Test that the file has the expected attributes.
 1437:     %% The times are tricky, so we will save them to a separate test case.
 1438:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1439:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1440:     #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1441: 	       atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo,
 1442:     io:format("Access ~p, Modify ~p", [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1443:     Size = 7,
 1444:     Type = regular,
 1445:     read_write = Access,
 1446:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(AccessTime, Config),
 1447: 			 filter_atime(ModifyTime,
 1448: 				      Config))) < 2,
 1449:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1450: 
 1451:     [] = flush(),
 1452:     ok.
 1453: 
 1454: file_info_basic_directory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1455:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1456:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1457:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1458:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1459: 
 1460:     %% Test that the RootDir directory has the expected attributes.
 1461:     test_directory(RootDir, read_write),
 1462: 
 1463:     %% Note that on Windows file systems, 
 1464:     %% "/" or "c:/" are *NOT* directories.
 1465:     %% Therefore, test that ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 behaves as if they were
 1466:     %% directories.
 1467:     case os:type() of
 1468:         {win32, _} ->
 1469:             test_directory("/", read_write),
 1470:             test_directory("c:/", read_write),
 1471:             test_directory("c:\\", read_write),
 1472:             test_directory("\\\\localhost\\c$", read_write);
 1473:         _ ->
 1474:             test_directory("/", read)
 1475:     end,
 1476:     ok.
 1477: 
 1478: test_directory(Name, ExpectedAccess) ->
 1479:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1480:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1481:     #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1482:                atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo,
 1483:     io:format("Testing directory ~s", [Name]),
 1484:     io:format("Directory size is ~p", [Size]),
 1485:     io:format("Access ~p", [Access]),
 1486:     io:format("Access time ~p; Modify time~p",
 1487: 	      [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1488:     Type = directory,
 1489:     Access = ExpectedAccess,
 1490:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1491:     [] = flush(),
 1492:     ok.
 1493: 
 1494: all_integers([{A,B,C}|T]) ->
 1495:     all_integers([A,B,C|T]);
 1496: all_integers([Int|Rest]) when is_integer(Int) ->
 1497:     all_integers(Rest);
 1498: all_integers([]) -> ok.
 1499: 
 1500: %% Try something nonexistent.
 1501: 
 1502: file_info_bad(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1503:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1504:     FileName = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_nonexistent"),
 1505:     {error,enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(FileName),
 1506:     {error,enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(FileName, [raw]),
 1507:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(""),
 1508:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info("", [raw]),
 1509:     [] = flush(),
 1510:     ok.
 1511: 
 1512: %% Test that the file times behave as they should.
 1513: 
 1514: file_info_times(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1515:     %% We have to try this twice, since if the test runs across the change
 1516:     %% of a month the time diff calculations will fail. But it won't happen
 1517:     %% if you run it twice in succession.
 1518:     test_server:m_out_of_n(
 1519:       1,2,
 1520:       fun() -> file_info_int(Config) end),
 1521:     ok.
 1522: 
 1523: file_info_int(Config) ->
 1524:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1525:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1526:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1527: 
 1528:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1529:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1530: 
 1531:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1532: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1533:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1534:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1535:     io:put_chars(Fd1,"foo"),
 1536: 
 1537:     %% check that the file got a modify date max a few seconds away from now
 1538:     {ok,FileInfo1} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1539:     {ok,FileInfo1Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1540: 
 1541:     %% We assert that everything but the size is the same, on some OSs the
 1542:     %% size may not have been flushed to disc and we do not want to do a
 1543:     %% sync to force it.
 1544:     FileInfo1Raw = FileInfo1#file_info{ size = FileInfo1Raw#file_info.size },
 1545: 
 1546:     #file_info{type=regular,atime=AccTime1,mtime=ModTime1} = FileInfo1,
 1547: 
 1548:     Now = erlang:localtime(), %???
 1549:     io:format("Now ~p",[Now]),
 1550:     io:format("Open file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime1,ModTime1]),
 1551:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(Now, Config),
 1552: 			 filter_atime(AccTime1,
 1553: 				      Config))) < 8,
 1554:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime1)) < 8,
 1555: 
 1556:     %% Sleep until we can be sure the seconds value has changed.
 1557:     %% Note: FAT-based filesystem (like on Windows 95) have
 1558:     %% a resolution of 2 seconds.
 1559:     timer:sleep(2200),
 1560: 
 1561:     %% close the file, and watch the modify date change
 1562:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1563:     {ok,FileInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1564:     {ok,FileInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1565:     #file_info{size=Size,type=regular,access=Access,
 1566:                atime=AccTime2,mtime=ModTime2} = FileInfo2,
 1567:     io:format("Closed file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime2,ModTime2]),
 1568:     true = time_dist(ModTime1,ModTime2) >= 0,
 1569: 
 1570:     %% this file is supposed to be binary, so it'd better keep it's size
 1571:     Size = 3,
 1572:     Access = read_write,
 1573: 
 1574:     %% Do some directory checking
 1575:     {ok,FileInfo3} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(RootDir),
 1576:     {ok,FileInfo3} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(RootDir, [raw]),
 1577:     #file_info{size=DSize,type=directory,access=DAccess,
 1578:                atime=AccTime3,mtime=ModTime3} = FileInfo3,
 1579:     %% this dir was modified only a few secs ago
 1580:     io:format("Dir Acc ~p; Mod ~p; Now ~p", [AccTime3, ModTime3, Now]),
 1581:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime3)) < 5,
 1582:     DAccess = read_write,
 1583:     io:format("Dir size is ~p",[DSize]),
 1584: 
 1585:     [] = flush(),
 1586:     ok.
 1587: 
 1588: %% Filter access times, to copy with a deficiency of FAT file systems
 1589: %% (on Windows): The access time is actually only a date.
 1590: 
 1591: filter_atime(Atime, Config) ->
 1592:     case lists:member(no_access_time, Config) of
 1593: 	true ->
 1594: 	    case Atime of
 1595: 	    	{Date, _} ->
 1596: 		    {Date, {0, 0, 0}};
 1597: 		{Y, M, D, _, _, _} ->
 1598: 		    {Y, M, D, 0, 0, 0}
 1599: 	    end;
 1600: 	false ->
 1601: 	    Atime
 1602:     end.
 1603: 
 1604: %% Test read_file_info on I/O devices.
 1605: 
 1606: file_handle_info_basic_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1607:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1608: 
 1609:     %% Create a short file.
 1610:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1611: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1612: 			 atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1613:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
 1614:     io:put_chars(Fd1, "foo bar"),
 1615:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1616: 
 1617:     %% Test that the file has the expected attributes.
 1618:     %% The times are tricky, so we will save them to a separate test case.
 1619: 
 1620:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read),
 1621:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd),
 1622:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 1623: 
 1624:     {ok, FdRaw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, raw]),
 1625:     {ok,FileInfoRaw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(FdRaw),
 1626:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(FdRaw),
 1627: 
 1628:     #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1629: 	       atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo = FileInfoRaw,
 1630:     io:format("Access ~p, Modify ~p", [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1631:     Size = 7,
 1632:     Type = regular,
 1633:     read_write = Access,
 1634:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(AccessTime, Config),
 1635: 			 filter_atime(ModifyTime,
 1636: 				      Config))) < 5,
 1637:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1638: 
 1639:     [] = flush(),
 1640:     ok.
 1641: 
 1642: file_handle_info_basic_directory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1643:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1644:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1645:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1646:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1647: 
 1648:     %% Test that the RootDir directory has the expected attributes.
 1649:     test_directory_handle(RootDir, read_write),
 1650: 
 1651:     %% Note that on Windows file systems,
 1652:     %% "/" or "c:/" are *NOT* directories.
 1653:     %% Therefore, test that ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 behaves as if they were
 1654:     %% directories.
 1655:     case os:type() of
 1656:         {win32, _} ->
 1657:             test_directory_handle("/", read_write),
 1658:             test_directory_handle("c:/", read_write),
 1659:             test_directory_handle("c:\\", read_write),
 1660:             test_directory_handle("\\\\localhost\\c$", read_write);
 1661:         _ ->
 1662:             test_directory_handle("/", read)
 1663:     end,
 1664:     ok.
 1665: 
 1666: test_directory_handle(Name, ExpectedAccess) ->
 1667:     {ok, DirFd} = file:open(Name, [read, directory]),
 1668:     try
 1669:         {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(DirFd),
 1670:         {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(DirFd, [raw]),
 1671:         #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1672:                    atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo,
 1673:         io:format("Testing directory ~s", [Name]),
 1674:         io:format("Directory size is ~p", [Size]),
 1675:         io:format("Access ~p", [Access]),
 1676:         io:format("Access time ~p; Modify time~p",
 1677:                   [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1678:         Type = directory,
 1679:         Access = ExpectedAccess,
 1680:         all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1681:         [] = flush(),
 1682:         ok
 1683:     after
 1684:         file:close(DirFd)
 1685:     end.
 1686: 
 1687: %% Test that the file times behave as they should.
 1688: 
 1689: file_handle_info_times(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1690:     %% We have to try this twice, since if the test runs across the change
 1691:     %% of a month the time diff calculations will fail. But it won't happen
 1692:     %% if you run it twice in succession.
 1693:     test_server:m_out_of_n(
 1694:       1,2,
 1695:       fun() -> file_handle_info_int(Config) end),
 1696:     ok.
 1697: 
 1698: file_handle_info_int(Config) ->
 1699:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1700:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1701:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1702: 
 1703:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1704:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1705: 
 1706:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1707: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1708: 			 atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1709:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
 1710:     io:put_chars(Fd1,"foo"),
 1711:     {ok,FileInfo1} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd1),
 1712:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1713: 
 1714:     {ok,Fd1Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, raw]),
 1715:     {ok,FileInfo1Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd1Raw),
 1716:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1Raw),
 1717: 
 1718:     %% We assert that everything but the size is the same, on some OSs the
 1719:     %% size may not have been flushed to disc and we do not want to do a
 1720:     %% sync to force it.
 1721:     FileInfo1Raw = FileInfo1#file_info{ size = FileInfo1Raw#file_info.size },
 1722: 
 1723:     #file_info{type=regular,atime=AccTime1,mtime=ModTime1} = FileInfo1,
 1724: 
 1725:     Now = erlang:localtime(), %???
 1726:     io:format("Now ~p",[Now]),
 1727:     io:format("Open file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime1,ModTime1]),
 1728:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(Now, Config),
 1729: 			 filter_atime(AccTime1,
 1730: 				      Config))) < 8,
 1731:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime1)) < 8,
 1732: 
 1733:     %% Sleep until we can be sure the seconds value has changed.
 1734:     %% Note: FAT-based filesystem (like on Windows 95) have
 1735:     %% a resolution of 2 seconds.
 1736:     timer:sleep(2200),
 1737: 
 1738:     %% close the file, and watch the modify date change
 1739: 
 1740:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read),
 1741:     {ok,FileInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd2),
 1742:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1743: 
 1744:     {ok,Fd2Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, raw]),
 1745:     {ok,FileInfo2Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd2Raw),
 1746:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2Raw),
 1747: 
 1748:     #file_info{size=Size,type=regular,access=Access,
 1749:                atime=AccTime2,mtime=ModTime2} = FileInfo2 = FileInfo2Raw,
 1750:     io:format("Closed file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime2,ModTime2]),
 1751:     true = time_dist(ModTime1,ModTime2) >= 0,
 1752: 
 1753:     %% this file is supposed to be binary, so it'd better keep it's size
 1754:     Size = 3,
 1755:     Access = read_write,
 1756: 
 1757:     %% Do some directory checking
 1758: 
 1759:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(RootDir, [read, directory]),
 1760:     {ok,FileInfo3} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd3),
 1761:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1762: 
 1763:     {ok,Fd3Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(RootDir, [read, directory, raw]),
 1764:     {ok,FileInfo3Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd3Raw),
 1765:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3Raw),
 1766: 
 1767:     #file_info{size=DSize,type=directory,access=DAccess,
 1768:                atime=AccTime3,mtime=ModTime3} = FileInfo3 = FileInfo3Raw,
 1769:     %% this dir was modified only a few secs ago
 1770:     io:format("Dir Acc ~p; Mod ~p; Now ~p", [AccTime3, ModTime3, Now]),
 1771:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime3)) < 5,
 1772:     DAccess = read_write,
 1773:     io:format("Dir size is ~p",[DSize]),
 1774: 
 1775:     [] = flush(),
 1776:     ok.
 1777: 
 1778: %% Test the write_file_info/2 function.
 1779: 
 1780: file_write_file_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1781:     RootDir = get_good_directory(Config),
 1782:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1783: 
 1784:     %% Set the file to read only AND update the file times at the same time.
 1785:     %% (This used to fail on Windows NT/95 for a local filesystem.)
 1786:     %% Note: Seconds must be even; see note in file_info_times/1.
 1787: 
 1788:     Name1 = filename:join(RootDir,
 1789: 			  atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1790: 			  ++"_write_file_info_ro"),
 1791:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello"),
 1792:     Time = {{1997, 01, 02}, {12, 35, 42}},
 1793:     Info = #file_info{mode=8#400, atime=Time, mtime=Time, ctime=Time},
 1794:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, Info),
 1795: 
 1796:     %% Read back the times.
 1797: 
 1798:     {ok, ActualInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name1),
 1799:     #file_info{mode=_Mode, atime=ActAtime, mtime=Time,
 1800: 	       ctime=ActCtime} = ActualInfo,
 1801:     FilteredAtime = filter_atime(Time, Config),
 1802:     FilteredAtime = filter_atime(ActAtime, Config),
 1803:     case os:type() of
 1804: 	{win32, _} ->
 1805: 	    %% On Windows, "ctime" means creation time and it can
 1806: 	    %% be set.
 1807: 	    ActCtime = Time;
 1808: 	_ ->
 1809: 	    ok
 1810:     end,
 1811:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1812: 
 1813:     %% Make the file writable again.
 1814: 
 1815:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#600}),
 1816:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1817: 
 1818:     %% And unwritable.
 1819:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#400}),
 1820:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1821: 
 1822:     %% Same with raw.
 1823:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#600}, [raw]),
 1824:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1825:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#400}, [raw]),
 1826:     {error,eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1827: 
 1828:     %% Write the times again.
 1829:     %% Note: Seconds must be even; see note in file_info_times/1.
 1830: 
 1831:     NewTime = {{1997, 02, 15}, {13, 18, 20}},
 1832:     NewInfo = #file_info{atime=NewTime, mtime=NewTime, ctime=NewTime},
 1833:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, NewInfo),
 1834:     {ok, ActualInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name1),
 1835:     #file_info{atime=NewActAtime, mtime=NewTime,
 1836: 	       ctime=NewActCtime} = ActualInfo2,
 1837:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewTime, Config),
 1838:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewActAtime, Config),
 1839:     case os:type() of
 1840: 	{win32, _} -> NewActCtime = NewTime;
 1841: 	_ -> ok
 1842:     end,
 1843: 
 1844:     %% The file should still be unwritable.
 1845:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1846: 
 1847:     %% Make the file writeable again, so that we can remove the
 1848:     %% test suites ... :-)
 1849:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#600}),
 1850: 
 1851:     [] = flush(),
 1852:     ok.
 1853: 
 1854: file_wfi_helpers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1855:     RootDir = get_good_directory(Config),
 1856:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1857: 
 1858:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1859:                          atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_wfi_helpers"),
 1860: 
 1861:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
 1862:     NewTime = {{1997, 02, 15}, {13, 18, 20}},
 1863:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:change_time(Name, NewTime, NewTime),
 1864: 
 1865:     {ok, #file_info{atime=NewActAtime, mtime=NewTime}} =
 1866:         ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1867: 
 1868:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewTime, Config),
 1869:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewActAtime, Config),
 1870: 
 1871:     %% Make the file unwritable
 1872:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:change_mode(Name, 8#400),
 1873:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
 1874: 
 1875:     %% ... and writable again
 1876:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:change_mode(Name, 8#600),
 1877:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
 1878: 
 1879:     %% We have no idea which users will work, so all we can do is to check
 1880:     %% that it returns enoent instead of crashing.
 1881:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:change_group("bogus file name", 0),
 1882:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:change_owner("bogus file name", 0),
 1883: 
 1884:     [] = flush(),
 1885:     ok.
 1886: 
 1887: %% Returns a directory on a file system that has correct file times.
 1888: 
 1889: get_good_directory(Config) ->
 1890:     proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
 1891: 
 1892: 
 1893: consult1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1894:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1895:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1896: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1897: 			 ++"_consult.fil"),
 1898:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1899:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 1900:     io:format(Fd1,
 1901: 	      "{this,[is,1.0],'journey'}.\n\"into\". (sound). ",
 1902: 	      []),
 1903:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1904:     {ok,[{this,[is,1.0],journey},"into",sound]} =
 1905: 	?FILE_MODULE:consult(Name),
 1906: 
 1907:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1908:     %% note the missing double quote
 1909:     io:format(
 1910:       Fd2,"{this,[is,1.0],'journey'}.\n \"into. (sound). ",[]),
 1911:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1912:     {error, {_, _, _} = Msg} = ?FILE_MODULE:consult(Name),
 1913:     io:format("Errmsg: ~p",[Msg]),
 1914: 
 1915:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:consult(Name ++ ".nonexistent"),
 1916: 
 1917:     [] = flush(),
 1918:     ok.
 1919: 
 1920: path_consult(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1921:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1922:     FileName = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_path_consult.fil",
 1923:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 1924:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1925:     io:format(Fd1,"{this,is,a,journey,into,sound}.\n",[]),
 1926:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1927:     %% File last in path
 1928:     {ok,[{this,is,a,journey,into,sound}],Dir} =
 1929: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_consult(
 1930: 	   [filename:join(RootDir, "dir1"),
 1931: 	    filename:join(RootDir, ".."),
 1932: 	    filename:join(RootDir, "dir2"),
 1933: 	    RootDir], FileName),
 1934:     true = lists:prefix(RootDir,Dir),
 1935: 
 1936:     %% While maybe not an error, it may be worth noting that
 1937:     %% when the full path to a file is given, it's always found
 1938:     %% regardless of the contents of the path
 1939:     {ok,_,_} = ?FILE_MODULE:path_consult(["nosuch1","nosuch2"],Name),
 1940: 
 1941:     [] = flush(),
 1942:     ok.
 1943: 
 1944: 
 1945: eval1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1946:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1947:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1948: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_eval.fil"),
 1949:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1950:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 1951:     io:format(Fd1,"put(evaluated_ok,\ntrue). ",[]),
 1952:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1953:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(Name),
 1954:     true = get(evaluated_ok),
 1955: 
 1956:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1957:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 1958:     io:format(Fd2,"put(evaluated_ok,\nR). ",[]),
 1959:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1960:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(
 1961: 	    Name,
 1962: 	    erl_eval:add_binding('R', true, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 1963:     true = get(evaluated_ok),
 1964: 
 1965:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1966:     %% garbled
 1967:     io:format(Fd3,"puGARBLED-GARBLED\ntrue). ",[]),
 1968:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1969:     {error, {_, _, _} = Msg} = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(Name),
 1970:     io:format("Errmsg1: ~p",[Msg]),
 1971: 
 1972:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(Name ++ ".nonexistent"),
 1973: 
 1974:     [] = flush(),
 1975:     ok.
 1976: 
 1977: path_eval(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1978:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1979:     FileName = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_path_eval.fil",
 1980:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 1981:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1982:     io:format(Fd1,"put(evaluated_ok,true).\n",[]),
 1983:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1984:     %% File last in path
 1985:     {ok,Dir} =
 1986: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_eval(
 1987: 	   [filename:join(RootDir, "dir1"),
 1988: 	    filename:join(RootDir, ".."),
 1989: 	    filename:join(RootDir, "dir2"),
 1990: 	    RootDir],FileName),
 1991:     true = get(evaluated_ok),
 1992:     true = lists:prefix(RootDir,Dir),
 1993: 
 1994:     %% While maybe not an error, it may be worth noting that
 1995:     %% when the full path to a file is given, it's always found
 1996:     %% regardless of the contents of the path
 1997:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1998:     io:format(Fd2,"put(evaluated_ok,R).\n",[]),
 1999:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2000:     {ok,_} = ?FILE_MODULE:path_eval(
 2001: 		["nosuch1","nosuch2"],
 2002: 		Name,
 2003: 		erl_eval:add_binding('R', true, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 2004: 
 2005:     [] = flush(),
 2006:     ok.
 2007: 
 2008: 
 2009: script1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2010:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2011:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 2012: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_script.fil"),
 2013:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2014:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 2015:     io:format(Fd1,"A = 11,\nB = 6,\nA+B. ",[]),
 2016:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 2017:     {ok,17} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(Name),
 2018: 
 2019:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2020:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 2021:     io:format(Fd2,"A = 11,\nA+B. ",[]),
 2022:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2023:     {ok,17} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(
 2024: 		 Name,
 2025: 		 erl_eval:add_binding('B', 6, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 2026: 
 2027:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2028:     io:format(Fd3,"A = 11,\nB = six,\nA+B. ",[]),
 2029:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 2030:     {error, {_, _, _} = Msg} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(Name),
 2031:     io:format("Errmsg1: ~p",[Msg]),
 2032: 
 2033:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(Name ++ ".nonexistent"),
 2034: 
 2035:     [] = flush(),
 2036:     ok.
 2037: 
 2038: path_script(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2039:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2040:     FileName = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_path_script.fil",
 2041:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 2042:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2043:     io:format(Fd1,"A = 11,\nB = 6,\nA+B.\n",[]),
 2044:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 2045:     %% File last in path
 2046:     {ok, 17, Dir} =
 2047: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_script(
 2048: 	   [filename:join(RootDir, "dir1"),
 2049: 	    filename:join(RootDir, ".."),
 2050: 	    filename:join(RootDir, "dir2"),
 2051: 	    RootDir],FileName),
 2052:     true = lists:prefix(RootDir,Dir),
 2053: 
 2054:     %% While maybe not an error, it may be worth noting that
 2055:     %% when the full path to a file is given, it's always found
 2056:     %% regardless of the contents of the path
 2057:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2058:     io:format(Fd2,"A = 11,\nA+B.",[]),
 2059:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2060:     {ok, 17, Dir} =
 2061: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_script(
 2062: 	   ["nosuch1","nosuch2"],
 2063: 	   Name,
 2064: 	   erl_eval:add_binding('B', 6, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 2065: 
 2066:     [] = flush(),
 2067:     ok.
 2068:

 2070: 
 2071: truncate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2072:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2073:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 2074: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 2075: 			 ++"_truncate.fil"),
 2076: 
 2077:     %% Create a file with some data.
 2078:     MyData = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz",
 2079:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, MyData),
 2080: 
 2081:     %% Truncate the file to 10 characters.
 2082:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read_write),
 2083:     {ok, 10} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd, 10),
 2084:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd),
 2085:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 2086: 
 2087:     %% Read back the file and check that it has been truncated.
 2088:     Expected = list_to_binary("0123456789"),
 2089:     {ok, Expected} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
 2090: 
 2091:     %% Open the file read only and verify that it is not possible to
 2092:     %% truncate it, OTP-1960
 2093:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read),
 2094:     {ok, 5} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, 5),
 2095:     {error, _} = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd2),
 2096: 
 2097:     [] = flush(),
 2098:     ok.
 2099: 
 2100: 
 2101: %% Tests that ?FILE_MODULE:datasync/1 at least doesn't crash.
 2102: datasync(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2103:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2104:     Sync = filename:join(PrivDir,
 2105: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 2106: 			 ++"_sync.fil"),
 2107: 
 2108:     %% Raw open.
 2109:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Sync, [write, raw]),
 2110:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:datasync(Fd),
 2111:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 2112: 
 2113:     %% Ordinary open.
 2114:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Sync, [write]),
 2115:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:datasync(Fd2),
 2116:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2117: 
 2118:     [] = flush(),
 2119:     ok.
 2120:
