 4010: 
 4011: %% OTP-10852. +fnu and latin1 filenames.
 4012: otp_10852(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4013:     case no_untranslatable_names() of
 4014:         fs ->
 4015:             {skip,"Not a problem on this FS"};
 4016: 	_ ->
 4017: 	    otp_10852_1(Config)
 4018:     end.
 4019: 
 4020: otp_10852_1(Config) ->
 4021:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnu"]),
 4022:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 4023:     B = filename:join(Dir, <<"\xE4">>),
 4024:     ok = rpc_call(Node, get_cwd, [B]),
 4025:     {error, no_translation} = rpc_call(Node, set_cwd, [B]),
 4026:     ok = rpc_call(Node, delete, [B]),
 4027:     ok = rpc_call(Node, rename, [B, B]),
 4028:     ok = rpc_call(Node, read_file_info, [B]),
 4029:     ok = rpc_call(Node, read_link_info, [B]),
 4030:     ok = rpc_call(Node, read_link, [B]),
 4031:     ok = rpc_call(Node, write_file_info, [B,#file_info{}]),
 4032:     ok = rpc_call(Node, list_dir, [B]),
 4033:     ok = rpc_call(Node, list_dir_all, [B]),
 4034:     ok = rpc_call(Node, read_file, [B]),
 4035:     ok = rpc_call(Node, make_link, [B,B]),
 4036:     case rpc_call(Node, make_symlink, [B,B]) of
 4037:         {error, eilseq} ->
 4038:             %% Some versions of OS X refuse to create files with illegal names.
 4039:             {unix,darwin} = os:type();
 4040:         {error, eperm} ->
 4041:             %% The test user might not have permission to create symlinks.
 4042:             {win32,_} = os:type();
 4043:         ok ->
 4044:             ok
 4045:     end,
 4046:     ok = rpc_call(Node, delete, [B]),
 4047:     case rpc_call(Node, make_dir, [B]) of
 4048:         {error, eilseq} ->
 4049:             {unix,darwin} = os:type();
 4050:         ok ->
 4051:             ok
 4052:     end,
 4053:     ok = rpc_call(Node, del_dir, [B]),
 4054:     case rpc_call(Node, write_file, [B,B]) of
 4055:         {error, eilseq} ->
 4056:             {unix,darwin} = os:type();
 4057:         ok ->
 4058:             {ok, Fd} = rpc_call(Node, open, [B,[read]]),
 4059:             ok = rpc_call(Node, close, [Fd]),
 4060:             {ok,0} = rpc_call(Node, copy, [B,B]),
 4061:             {ok, Fd2, B} = rpc_call(Node, path_open, [["."], B, [read]]),
 4062:             ok = rpc_call(Node, close, [Fd2])
 4063:     end,
 4064:     peer:stop(Peer),
 4065:     ok.
 4066: 
 4067: rpc_call(N, F, As) ->
 4068:     case rpc:call(N, ?FILE_MODULE, F, As) of
 4069:         {error, enotsup} -> ok;
 4070:         {error, enoent} -> ok;
 4071:         {error, badarg} -> ok;
 4072:         Else -> Else
 4073:     end.
 4074: 
 4075: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4076: 
 4077: large_file() ->
 4078:     [{timetrap,{minutes,20}}].
 4079: 
 4080: %% Tests positioning in large files (> 4G).
 4081: large_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4082:     run_large_file_test(Config,
 4083: 			fun(Name) -> do_large_file(Name) end,
 4084: 			"_large_file").
 4085: 
 4086: do_large_file(Name) ->
 4087:     S = "1234567890",
 4088:     L = length(S),
 4089:     R = lists:reverse(S),
 4090:     P = 1 bsl 32,
 4091:     Ss = lists:sort(S),
 4092:     Rs = lists:reverse(Ss),
 4093:     {ok,F}  = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [raw,read,write]),
 4094:     ok      = ?FILE_MODULE:write(F, S),
 4095:     {ok,P}  = ?FILE_MODULE:position(F, P),
 4096:     ok      = ?FILE_MODULE:write(F, R),
 4097:     {ok,0}  = ?FILE_MODULE:position(F, bof),
 4098:     {ok,S}  = ?FILE_MODULE:read(F, L),
 4099:     {ok,P}  = ?FILE_MODULE:position(F, {eof,-L}),
 4100:     {ok,R}  = ?FILE_MODULE:read(F, L+1),
 4101:     {ok,S}  = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(F, 0, L),
 4102:     {ok,R}  = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(F, P, L+1),
 4103:     ok      = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(F, 0, Ss),
 4104:     ok      = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(F, P, Rs),
 4105:     {ok,0}  = ?FILE_MODULE:position(F, bof),
 4106:     {ok,Ss} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(F, L),
 4107:     {ok,P}  = ?FILE_MODULE:position(F, {eof,-L}),
 4108:     {ok,Rs} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(F, L+1),
 4109:     ok      = ?FILE_MODULE:close(F),
 4110:     %% Reopen the file with 'append'; used to fail on Windows causing
 4111:     %% writes to go to the beginning of the file for files > 4GB.
 4112:     PL = P + L,
 4113:     PLL = PL + L,
 4114:     {ok,F1}  = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [raw,read,write,append]),
 4115:     ok       = ?FILE_MODULE:write(F1, R),
 4116:     {ok,PLL} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(F1, {cur,0}),
 4117:     {ok,Rs}  = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(F1, P, L),
 4118:     {ok,PL}  = ?FILE_MODULE:position(F1, {eof,-L}),
 4119:     {ok,R}   = ?FILE_MODULE:read(F1, L+1),
 4120:     ok       = ?FILE_MODULE:close(F1),
 4121: 
 4122:     %% Reopen the file try to read all of it; used to fail on macOS
 4123:     %% We open with binary in order to not get a memory explosion.
 4124:     {ok, F2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [raw,read,binary]),
 4125:     IsWindows = element(1,os:type()) =:= win32,
 4126:     case {?FILE_MODULE:read(F2, P), erlang:system_info(wordsize)} of
 4127:         {{ok, B}, 8} ->
 4128:             P = byte_size(B);
 4129:         {eof, 8} when IsWindows ->
 4130:             ok;
 4131:         {eof, 4} ->
 4132:             %% Cannot read such large files on 32-bit
 4133:             ok
 4134:     end,
 4135:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(F2),
 4136: 
 4137:     ok.
 4138: 
 4139: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4140: 
 4141: large_write() ->
 4142:     [{timetrap,{minutes,20}}].
 4143: 
 4144: large_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4145:     run_large_file_test(Config,
 4146: 			fun(Name) -> do_large_write(Name) end,
 4147: 			"_large_write").
 4148: 
 4149: do_large_write(Name) ->
 4150:     Memsize = memsize(),
 4151:     io:format("Memsize = ~w Bytes~n", [Memsize]),
 4152:     case {erlang:system_info(wordsize),Memsize} of
 4153: 	{4,_} ->
 4154: 	    {skip,"Needs a 64-bit emulator"};
 4155: 	{8,N} when N < 6 bsl 30 ->
 4156: 	    {skip,
 4157: 	     "This machine has < 6 GB  memory: "
 4158: 	     ++integer_to_list(N)};
 4159: 	{8,_} ->
 4160: 	    Size = 4*1024*1024*1024+1,
 4161: 	    Bin = <<0:Size/unit:8>>,
 4162: 	    ok = file:write_file(Name, Bin),
 4163: 	    {ok,#file_info{size=Size}} = file:read_file_info(Name),
 4164: 
 4165:             %% Even multiples of MAX_SYSIOVEC_IOVLEN would cause a crash
 4166:             ok = file:write_file(Name, binary:part(Bin, 0, 1 bsl 31)),
 4167: 	    {ok,#file_info{size=1 bsl 31}} = file:read_file_info(Name),
 4168: 	    ok
 4169:     end.
 4170: 
 4171: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4172: 
 4173: %% Benchmarks
 4174: %%
 4175: %% Note that we only measure the time it takes to run the isolated file
 4176: %% operations and that the actual test runtime can differ significantly,
 4177: %% especially on the write side as the files need to be truncated before
 4178: %% writing.
 4179: 
 4180: large_writes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4181:     Modes = [raw, binary],
 4182:     OpCount = 4096,
 4183:     Data = <<0:(64 bsl 10)/unit:8>>,
 4184:     run_write_benchmark(Config, Modes, OpCount, Data).
 4185: 
 4186: large_writes_delayed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4187:     %% Each write is exactly as large as the delay buffer, causing the writes
 4188:     %% to pass through each time, giving us a decent idea of how much overhead
 4189:     %% delayed_write adds.
 4190:     Modes = [raw, binary, {delayed_write, 64 bsl 10, 2000}],
 4191:     OpCount = 4096,
 4192:     Data = <<0:(64 bsl 10)/unit:8>>,
 4193:     run_write_benchmark(Config, Modes, OpCount, Data).
 4194: 
 4195: tiny_writes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4196:     Modes = [raw, binary],
 4197:     OpCount = 512 bsl 10,
 4198:     Data = <<0>>,
 4199:     run_write_benchmark(Config, Modes, OpCount, Data).
 4200: 
 4201: tiny_writes_delayed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4202:     Modes = [raw, binary, {delayed_write, 512 bsl 10, 2000}],
 4203:     OpCount = 512 bsl 10,
 4204:     Data = <<0>>,
 4205:     run_write_benchmark(Config, Modes, OpCount, Data).
 4206: 
 4207: %% The read benchmarks assume that "benchmark_scratch_file" has been filled by
 4208: %% the write benchmarks.
 4209: 
 4210: tiny_reads(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4211:     Modes = [raw, binary],
 4212:     OpCount = 512 bsl 10,
 4213:     run_read_benchmark(Config, Modes, OpCount, 1).
 4214: 
 4215: tiny_reads_ahead(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4216:     Modes = [raw, binary, {read_ahead, 512 bsl 10}],
 4217:     OpCount = 512 bsl 10,
 4218:     run_read_benchmark(Config, Modes, OpCount, 1).
 4219: 
 4220: run_write_benchmark(Config, Modes, OpCount, Data) ->
 4221:     run_benchmark(Config, [write | Modes], OpCount, fun file:write/2, Data).
 4222: 
 4223: run_read_benchmark(Config, Modes, OpCount, OpSize) ->
 4224:     run_benchmark(Config, [read | Modes], OpCount, fun file:read/2, OpSize).
 4225: 
 4226: run_benchmark(Config, Modes, OpCount, Fun, Arg) ->
 4227:     ScratchDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 4228:     Path = filename:join(ScratchDir, "benchmark_scratch_file"),
 4229:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(Path, Modes),
 4230:     submit_throughput_results(Fun, [Fd, Arg], OpCount).
 4231: 
 4232: submit_throughput_results(Fun, Args, Times) ->
 4233:     MSecs = measure_repeated_file_op(Fun, Args, Times, millisecond),
 4234:     IOPS = trunc(Times * (1000 / MSecs)),
 4235:     ct_event:notify(#event{ name = benchmark_data, data = [{value,IOPS}] }),
 4236:     {comment, io_lib:format("~p IOPS, ~p ms", [IOPS, trunc(MSecs)])}.
 4237: 
 4238: measure_repeated_file_op(Fun, Args, Times, Unit) ->
 4239:     Start = os:perf_counter(Unit),
 4240:     repeated_apply(Fun, Args, Times),
 4241:     os:perf_counter(Unit) - Start.
 4242: 
 4243: repeated_apply(_F, _Args, Times) when Times =< 0 ->
 4244:     ok;
 4245: repeated_apply(F, Args, Times) ->
 4246:     erlang:apply(F, Args),
 4247:     repeated_apply(F, Args, Times - 1).
 4248: 
 4249: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4250: 
 4251: 
 4252: response_analysis(Module, Function, Arguments) ->
 4253:     Parent = self(),
 4254:     erlang:yield(), % Schedule out before test
 4255:     Child =
 4256: 	spawn_link(
 4257: 	  fun () ->
 4258: 		  receive {Parent, start, Ts} -> ok end,
 4259: 		  Stat = 
 4260: 		      iterate(response_stat(response_stat(init, Ts),
 4261: 					    micro_ts()),
 4262: 			      done,
 4263: 			      fun (S) ->
 4264: 				      erlang:yield(),
 4265: 				      receive
 4266: 					  {Parent, stop} ->
 4267: 					      done
 4268: 				      after 0 ->
 4269: 					      response_stat(S, micro_ts())
 4270: 				      end
 4271: 			      end),
 4272: 		  Parent ! {self(), stopped, response_stat(Stat, micro_ts())}
 4273: 	  end),
 4274:     Child ! {Parent, start, micro_ts()},
 4275:     Result = apply(Module, Function, Arguments),
 4276:     Child ! {Parent, stop},
 4277:     {N, Sum, _, M, Max} = receive {Child, stopped, X} -> X end,
 4278:     Mean_ms = (0.001*Sum) / (N-1),
 4279:     Max_ms = 0.001 * Max,
 4280:     Comment =
 4281: 	lists:flatten(
 4282: 	  io_lib:format(
 4283: 	    "Scheduling interval: Mean = ~.3f ms, "
 4284: 	    ++"Max = ~.3f ms for no ~p of ~p.~n",
 4285: 	    [Mean_ms, Max_ms, M, (N-1)])),
 4286:     {Result, Comment}.
 4287: 
 4288: micro_ts() ->
 4289:     erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond).
 4290: 
 4291: response_stat(init, Ts) ->
 4292:     {0, 0, Ts, 0, 0};
 4293: response_stat({N, Sum, Ts0, M, Max}, Ts) ->
 4294:     D = Ts - Ts0,
 4295:     if D > Max ->
 4296: 	    {N+1, Sum+D, Ts, N, D};
 4297:        true ->
 4298: 	    {N+1, Sum+D, Ts, M, Max}
 4299:     end.
 4300: 
 4301: 
 4302: 
 4303: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4304: 
 4305: 
 4306: 
 4307: %% This function is kept just for benchmarking reasons.
 4308: %% create_file/2 below is some 44 times faster.
 4309: 
 4310: create_file_slow(Name, N) when is_integer(N), N >= 0 ->
 4311:     {ok, FD} =
 4312: 	?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [raw, write, delayed_write, binary]),
 4313:     ok = create_file_slow(FD, 0, N),
 4314:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(FD),
 4315:     ok.
 4316: 
 4317: create_file_slow(_FD, M, M) ->
 4318:     ok;
 4319: create_file_slow(FD, M, N) ->
 4320:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write(FD, <<M:32/unsigned>>),
 4321:     create_file_slow(FD, M+1, N).
 4322: 
 4323: 
 4324: 
 4325: %% Creates a file 'Name' containing 'N' unsigned 32 bit integers 
 4326: %% from 0 to N-1.
 4327: 
 4328: create_file(Name, N) when is_integer(N), N >= 0 ->
 4329:     {ok, FD} =
 4330: 	?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [raw, write, delayed_write, binary]),
 4331:     ok = create_file(FD, 0, N),
 4332:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(FD),
 4333:     ok.
 4334: 
 4335: create_file(_FD, M, M) ->
 4336:     ok;
 4337: create_file(FD, M, N) when M + 1024 =< N ->
 4338:     create_file(FD, M, M + 1024, []),
 4339:     create_file(FD, M + 1024, N);
 4340: create_file(FD, M, N) ->
 4341:     create_file(FD, M, N, []).
 4342: 
 4343: create_file(FD, M, M, R) ->
 4344:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write(FD, R);
 4345: create_file(FD, M, N0, R) when M + 8 =< N0 ->
 4346:     N1  = N0-1,  N2  = N0-2,  N3  = N0-3,  N4  = N0-4, 
 4347:     N5  = N0-5,  N6  = N0-6,  N7  = N0-7,  N8  = N0-8, 
 4348:     create_file(FD, M, N8, 
 4349: 		[<<N8:32/unsigned,  N7:32/unsigned,
 4350: 		   N6:32/unsigned,  N5:32/unsigned,
 4351: 		   N4:32/unsigned,  N3:32/unsigned,
 4352: 		   N2:32/unsigned,  N1:32/unsigned>> | R]);
 4353: create_file(FD, M, N0, R) ->
 4354:     N1 = N0-1,
 4355:     create_file(FD, M, N1, [<<N1:32/unsigned>> | R]).
 4356: 
 4357: 
 4358: 
 4359: create_bin(M, N) when is_integer(M), is_integer(N), N >= 0, M >= 0 ->
 4360:     create_bin(M, M+N, []).
 4361: 
 4362: create_bin(N, N, R) ->
 4363:     list_to_binary(R);
 4364: create_bin(M, N0, R) when M+8 =< N0 ->
 4365:     N1  = N0-1,  N2  = N0-2,  N3  = N0-3,  N4  = N0-4, 
 4366:     N5  = N0-5,  N6  = N0-6,  N7  = N0-7,  N8  = N0-8, 
 4367:     create_bin(M, N8,
 4368: 	       [<<N8:32/unsigned,  N7:32/unsigned, 
 4369: 		  N6:32/unsigned,  N5:32/unsigned,
 4370: 		  N4:32/unsigned,  N3:32/unsigned,
 4371: 		  N2:32/unsigned,  N1:32/unsigned>> | R]);
 4372: create_bin(M, N0, R) ->
 4373:     N1 = N0-1,
 4374:     create_bin(M, N1, [<<N1:32/unsigned>> | R]).
 4375: 
 4376: 
 4377: 
 4378: 
 4379: verify_bin(<<>>, _, 0) ->
 4380:     true;
 4381: verify_bin(<<>>, _, _) ->
 4382:     false;
 4383: verify_bin(Bin, N, Cnt) ->
 4384:     N0 = N + 0, N1 = N + 1, N2 = N + 2, N3 = N + 3, 
 4385:     N4 = N + 4, N5 = N + 5, N6 = N + 6, N7 = N + 7, 
 4386:     case Bin of
 4387: 	<<N0:32/unsigned, N1:32/unsigned, N2:32/unsigned, N3:32/unsigned, 
 4388: 	  N4:32/unsigned, N5:32/unsigned, N6:32/unsigned, N7:32/unsigned,
 4389: 	  B/binary>> ->
 4390: 	    verify_bin(B, N+8, Cnt-8);
 4391: 	<<N:32/unsigned, B/binary>> ->
 4392: 	    verify_bin(B, N+1, Cnt-1);
 4393: 	_ ->
 4394: 	    false
 4395:     end.
 4396: 
 4397: 
 4398: 
 4399: verify_file(Name, N) when is_integer(N), N >= 0 ->
 4400:     case ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [raw, read, binary]) of
 4401: 	{ok, FD} ->
 4402: 	    Result = verify_file(FD, 0, 64*1024, N),
 4403: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(FD),
 4404: 	    Result;
 4405: 	Error ->
 4406: 	    Error
 4407:     end.
 4408: 
 4409: verify_file(FD, N, _, N) ->
 4410:     case ?FILE_MODULE:read(FD, 1) of
 4411: 	eof ->
 4412: 	    true;
 4413: 	{ok, _} ->
 4414: 	    false
 4415:     end;
 4416: verify_file(FD, M, Cnt, N) when M+Cnt =< N ->
 4417:     case ?FILE_MODULE:read(FD, 4*Cnt) of
 4418: 	{ok, Bin} ->
 4419: 	    case verify_bin(Bin, M, Cnt) of
 4420: 		true ->
 4421: 		    verify_file(FD, M+Cnt, Cnt, N);
 4422: 		false ->
 4423: 		    false
 4424: 	    end;
 4425: 	_ ->
 4426: 	    false
 4427:     end;
 4428: verify_file(FD, M, _Cnt, N) ->
 4429:     verify_file(FD, M, N-M, N).
 4430: 
 4431: 
 4432: 
 4433: subbin(Bin, M, N) ->
 4434:     <<_:M/binary, B:N/binary, _/binary>> = Bin,
 4435:     B.
 4436: 
 4437: 
 4438: 
 4439: write_file(Name, Data) ->
 4440:     case ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [raw, write, binary]) of
 4441: 	{ok, FD} ->
 4442: 	    Result = ?FILE_MODULE:write(FD, Data),
 4443: 	    case {Result, ?FILE_MODULE:close(FD)} of
 4444: 		{ok, R} -> R;
 4445: 		_ -> Result
 4446: 	    end;
 4447: 	Error ->
 4448: 	    Error
 4449:     end.
 4450: 
 4451: pwrite_file(Name, Data) ->
 4452:     case ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [raw, write, binary]) of
 4453: 	{ok, FD} ->
 4454: 	    Result = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(FD, Data),
 4455: 	    case {Result, ?FILE_MODULE:close(FD)} of
 4456: 		{ok, R} -> R;
 4457: 		_ -> Result
 4458: 	    end;
 4459: 	Error ->
 4460: 	    Error
 4461:     end.
 4462: 
 4463: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4464: %% Read_line tests
 4465: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

 4467: 
 4468: read_line_testdata(PrivDir) ->
 4469:     All0 = [{fun read_line_create0/1,"Testdata1.txt",5,10},
 4470: 	    {fun read_line_create1/1,"Testdata2.txt",401,802},
 4471: 	    {fun read_line_create2/1,"Testdata3.txt",1,2},
 4472: 	    {fun read_line_create3/1,"Testdata4.txt",601,fail},
 4473: 	    {fun read_line_create4/1,"Testdata5.txt",601,1002},
 4474: 	    {fun read_line_create5/1,"Testdata6.txt",601,1202},
 4475: 	    {fun read_line_create6/1,"Testdata7.txt",601,1202},
 4476: 	    {fun read_line_create7/1,"Testdata8.txt",4001,8002}],
 4477:     [ {A,filename:join([PrivDir,B]),C,D} || {A,B,C,D} <- All0 ].
 4478: 
 4479: read_line_create_files(TestData) ->
 4480:     [ Function(File) || {Function,File,_,_} <- TestData ].
 4481: 
 4482: read_line_remove_files(TestData) ->
 4483:     [ file:delete(File) || {_Function,File,_,_} <- TestData ].
 4484: 
 4485: %% read_line with ?PRIM_FILE.
 4486: read_line_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4487:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 4488:     All = read_line_testdata(PrivDir),
 4489:     read_line_create_files(All),
 4490:     [ begin
 4491: 	  io:format("read_line_all: ~s~n",[File]),
 4492: 	  {X,_} = read_line_all(File),
 4493: 	  true
 4494:       end || {_,File,X,_} <- All ],
 4495:     [ begin
 4496: 	  io:format("read_line_all_alternating: ~s~n",[File]),
 4497: 	  {Y,_} = read_line_all_alternating(File),
 4498: 	  true
 4499:       end || {_,File,_,Y} <- All , Y =/= fail],
 4500:     [ begin
 4501: 	  io:format("read_line_all_alternating (failing as should): ~s~n",[File]),
 4502: 	  {'EXIT',_} = (catch read_line_all_alternating(File)),
 4503: 	  true
 4504:       end || {_,File,_,Y} <- All , Y =:= fail],
 4505:     read_line_remove_files(All),
 4506:     ok.
 4507: %% read_line with file.
 4508: read_line_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4509:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),

 4514: 	  {X,_} = read_line_all2(File),
 4515: 	  true
 4516:       end || {_,File,X,_} <- All ],
 4517:     [ begin
 4518: 	  io:format("read_line_all_alternating: ~s~n",[File]),
 4519: 	  {Y,_} = read_line_all_alternating2(File),
 4520: 	  true
 4521:       end || {_,File,_,Y} <- All , Y =/= fail],
 4522:     [ begin
 4523: 	  io:format("read_line_all_alternating (failing as should): ~s~n",[File]),
 4524: 	  {'EXIT',_} = (catch read_line_all_alternating2(File)),
 4525: 	  true
 4526:       end || {_,File,_,Y} <- All , Y =:= fail],
 4527:     read_line_remove_files(All),
 4528:     ok.

 4574: rl_lines() ->
 4575:     [ <<"hej">>,<<"hopp">>,<<"i">>,<<"lingon\rskogen">>].
 4576: 
 4577: read_line_create0(Filename) ->
 4578:     {ok,F} = file:open(Filename,[write]),
 4579:     L = rl_lines(),
 4580:     [ file:write(F,[R,<<"\r\n">>]) || R <- L ], 
 4581:     file:write(F,<<"Inget radslut\r">>),
 4582:     file:close(F).
 4583: read_line_create1(Filename) ->
 4584:     {ok,F} = file:open(Filename,[write]),
 4585:     L = rl_lines(),
 4586:     [ begin
 4587: 	  [ file:write(F,[R,<<"\r\n">>]) || R <- L ], 
 4588: 	  file:write(F,<<"Inget radslut\r">>)
 4589:       end || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
 4590:     file:close(F).
 4591: read_line_create2(Filename) ->
 4592:     {ok,F} = file:open(Filename,[write]),
 4593:     L = rl_lines(),
 4594:     [ begin
 4595: 	  [ file:write(F,[R]) || R <- L ], 
 4596: 	  file:write(F,<<"Inget radslut\r">>)
 4597:       end || _ <- lists:seq(1,200)],
 4598:     file:write(F,<<"\r\n">>),
 4599:     file:close(F).
 4600:

 4652: 
 4653: read_line_all(Filename) ->
 4654:     {ok,F} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Filename,[read,binary]),
 4655:     X=read_rl_lines(F),
 4656:     ?PRIM_FILE:close(F),
 4657:     Bin = list_to_binary([B || {ok,B} <- X]),
 4658:     Bin = re:replace(list_to_binary([element(2,file:read_file(Filename))]),
 4659: 		     "\r\n","\n",[global,{return,binary}]),
 4660:     {length(X),Bin}.
 4661: 
 4662: read_line_all2(Filename) ->
 4663:     {ok,F} = file:open(Filename,[read,binary]),
 4664:     X=read_rl_lines2(F),
 4665:     file:close(F),
 4666:     Bin = list_to_binary([B || {ok,B} <- X]),
 4667:     Bin = re:replace(list_to_binary([element(2,file:read_file(Filename))]),
 4668: 		     "\r\n","\n",[global,{return,binary}]),
 4669:     {length(X),Bin}.
 4670: 
 4671: read_line_all3(Filename) ->
 4672:     {ok,F} = file:open(Filename,[read,binary,raw]),
 4673:     X=read_rl_lines2(F),
 4674:     file:close(F),
 4675:     Bin = list_to_binary([B || {ok,B} <- X]),
 4676:     Bin = re:replace(list_to_binary([element(2,file:read_file(Filename))]),
 4677: 		     "\r\n","\n",[global,{return,binary}]),
 4678:     {length(X),Bin}.
 4679: read_line_all4(Filename) ->
 4680:     {ok,F} = file:open(Filename,[read,binary,raw,{read_ahead,8192}]),
 4681:     X=read_rl_lines2(F),
 4682:     file:close(F),
 4683:     Bin = list_to_binary([B || {ok,B} <- X]),
 4684:     Bin = re:replace(list_to_binary([element(2,file:read_file(Filename))]),
 4685: 		     "\r\n","\n",[global,{return,binary}]),
 4686:     {length(X),Bin}.
 4687: 
 4688: read_rl_lines(F) ->
 4689:     case ?PRIM_FILE:read_line(F) of
 4690: 	eof ->
 4691: 	    [];
 4692: 	{error,X} ->
 4693: 	    {error,X};
 4694: 	List ->
 4695: 	    [List | read_rl_lines(F)]
 4696:     end.
 4697: 
 4698: read_rl_lines2(F) ->
 4699:     case file:read_line(F) of
 4700: 	eof ->
 4701: 	    [];
 4702: 	{error,X} ->
 4703: 	    {error,X};
 4704: 	List ->
 4705: 	    [List | read_rl_lines2(F)]
 4706:     end.
 4707: 
 4708: read_line_all_alternating(Filename) ->
 4709:     {ok,F} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Filename,[read,binary]),
 4710:     X=read_rl_lines(F,true),
 4711:     ?PRIM_FILE:close(F),
 4712:     Bin = list_to_binary([B || {ok,B} <- X]),
 4713:     Bin = re:replace(list_to_binary([element(2,file:read_file(Filename))]),
 4714: 		     "\r\n","\n",[global,{return,binary}]),
 4715:     {length(X),Bin}.
 4716: 
 4717: read_line_all_alternating2(Filename) ->
 4718:     {ok,F} = file:open(Filename,[read,binary]),
 4719:     X=read_rl_lines2(F,true),
 4720:     file:close(F),
 4721:     Bin = list_to_binary([B || {ok,B} <- X]),
 4722:     Bin = re:replace(list_to_binary([element(2,file:read_file(Filename))]),
 4723: 		     "\r\n","\n",[global,{return,binary}]),
 4724:     {length(X),Bin}.
 4725: read_line_all_alternating3(Filename) ->
 4726:     {ok,F} = file:open(Filename,[read,binary,raw]),
 4727:     X=read_rl_lines2(F,true),
 4728:     file:close(F),
 4729:     Bin = list_to_binary([B || {ok,B} <- X]),
 4730:     Bin = re:replace(list_to_binary([element(2,file:read_file(Filename))]),
 4731: 		     "\r\n","\n",[global,{return,binary}]),
 4732:     {length(X),Bin}.
 4733: read_line_all_alternating4(Filename) ->
 4734:     {ok,F} = file:open(Filename,[read,binary,raw,{read_ahead,8192}]),
 4735:     X=read_rl_lines2(F,true),
 4736:     file:close(F),
 4737:     Bin = list_to_binary([B || {ok,B} <- X]),
 4738:     Bin = re:replace(list_to_binary([element(2,file:read_file(Filename))]),
 4739: 		     "\r\n","\n",[global,{return,binary}]),
 4740:     {length(X),Bin}.
 4741: 
 4742: read_rl_lines(F,Alternate) ->
 4743:     case begin
 4744: 	     case Alternate of
 4745: 		 true -> ?PRIM_FILE:read(F,1);
 4746: 		 false -> ?PRIM_FILE:read_line(F)
 4747: 	     end 
 4748: 	 end of
 4749: 	eof ->
 4750: 	    [];
 4751: 	{error,X} ->
 4752: 	    {error,X};
 4753: 	List ->
 4754: 	    [List | read_rl_lines(F,not Alternate)]
 4755:     end.
 4756: read_rl_lines2(F,Alternate) ->
 4757:     case begin
 4758: 	     case Alternate of
 4759: 		 true -> file:read(F,1);
 4760: 		 false -> file:read_line(F)
 4761: 	     end 
 4762: 	 end of
 4763: 	eof ->
 4764: 	    [];
 4765: 	{error,X} ->
 4766: 	    {error,X};
 4767: 	List ->
 4768: 	    [List | read_rl_lines2(F,not Alternate)]
 4769:     end.
 4770: 
 4771: 
 4772: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4773: 
 4774: bytes(B, N)
 4775:   when is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B =< 255, is_integer(N), N > 2, N band 1 == 0 ->
 4776:     [bytes(B, N bsr 1), bytes(B, N bsr 1)];
 4777: bytes(B, 0)
 4778:   when is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B =< 255 ->
 4779:     [];
 4780: bytes(B, 2)
 4781:   when is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B =< 255 ->
 4782:     [B, B];
 4783: bytes(B, N)
 4784:   when is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B =< 255, is_integer(N), N > 0 ->
 4785:     [B, bytes(B, N-1)].
 4786: 
 4787: 
 4788: %% A simple loop construct.
 4789: %%
 4790: %% Calls 'Fun' with argument 'Start' first and then repeatedly with
 4791: %% its returned value (state) until 'Fun' returns 'Stop'. Then
 4792: %% the last state value that was not 'Stop' is returned.
 4793: 
 4794: iterate(Start, Done, Fun) when is_function(Fun) ->
 4795:     iterate(Start, Done, Fun, Start).
 4796: 
 4797: iterate(Done, Done, _Fun, I) ->
 4798:     I;
 4799: iterate(I, Done, Fun, _) ->
 4800:     iterate(Fun(I), Done, Fun, I).
 4801: 
 4802: 
 4803: 
 4804: flush() ->
 4805:     flush([]).
 4806: 
 4807: flush(Msgs) ->
 4808:     receive
 4809: 	Msg ->
 4810: 	    flush([Msg | Msgs])
 4811:     after 0 ->
 4812: 	    lists:reverse(Msgs)
 4813:     end.
 4814: 
 4815: %%%
 4816: %%% Support for testing large files.
 4817: %%%
 4818: 
 4819: run_large_file_test(Config, Run, Name) ->
 4820:     case {os:type(),os:version()} of
 4821: 	{{win32,nt},_} ->
 4822: 	    do_run_large_file_test(Config, Run, Name);
 4823: 	{{unix,sunos},OsVersion} when OsVersion < {5,5,1} ->
 4824: 	    {skip,"Only supported on Win32, Unix or SunOS >= 5.5.1"};
 4825: 	{{unix,_},_} ->
 4826:             case disc_free(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)) of
 4827:                 error ->
 4828:                     {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
 4829:                            "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
 4830:                 N when N >= 5 * (1 bsl 20) ->
 4831:                     ct:pal("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
 4832:                     do_run_large_file_test(Config, Run, Name);
 4833:                 N when N < 5 * (1 bsl 20) ->
 4834:                     ct:pal("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
 4835:                     {skip,"Less than 5 GByte free"}
 4836:             end;
 4837: 	_ ->
 4838: 	    {skip,"Only supported on Win32, Unix or SunOS >= 5.5.1"}
 4839:     end.
 4840: 
 4841: 
 4842: do_run_large_file_test(Config, Run, Name0) ->
 4843:     Name = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 4844: 			 ?MODULE_STRING ++ Name0),
 4845: 
 4846:     %% We run the test in a peer node in case the OOM killer
 4847:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 4848: 
 4849:     erpc:call(Node, application, ensure_all_started, [os_mon]),
 4850: 
 4851:     %% Set up a process that will delete this file.
 4852:     Tester = self(),
 4853:     Deleter = 
 4854:         spawn(
 4855:           fun() ->
 4856:                   Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 4857:                   receive
 4858:                       {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,_} -> ok;
 4859:                       {Tester,done} -> ok
 4860:                   end,
 4861:                   ?FILE_MODULE:delete(Name)
 4862:           end),
 4863: 
 4864:     %% Run the test case.
 4865:     try
 4866:         Res = erpc:call(Node, fun() -> Run(Name) end),
 4867: 
 4868:         %% Delete file and finish deleter process.
 4869:         Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Deleter),
 4870:         Deleter ! {Tester,done},
 4871:         receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,_} -> ok end,
 4872: 
 4873:         Res
 4874:     after
 4875:         peer:stop(Peer)
 4876:     end.
 4877: 
 4878: disc_free(Path) ->
 4879:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 4880: 
 4881:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 4882:     Partitions =
 4883:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 4884:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 4885: 
 4886:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 4887:     %% path first.
 4888:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 4889:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 4890:         [] -> error
 4891:     end.
 4892: 
 4893: memsize() ->
 4894:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 4895:         undefined ->
 4896:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 4897:             Tot;
 4898:         Available ->
 4899:             Available
 4900:     end.
